title: Chuckit! Fetch Flight Dog Toy, Multicolor
descriptions:
["Show your furry friend a high-flying good time with the Chuckit! Fetch Flight Dog Toy. This flexible flyer has a rubber pyramid structure that provides a softer feel on your pup's mouth and a unique EZ Grip design that makes it easier to pick up. It features a durable inner sail that flexes with each flight, allowing for better loft during play. This interactive toy also has bright colors for increased visibility and to ensure it does not get lost. Get your paw-tner into some wide-open spaces and watch him chase after the Chuckit! Fetch Flight Dog Toy for hours of fun.", 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. ']
key_benefits: ['Interactive toy ideal for a game of fetch with your furry friend.', 'Features a durable inner sail that flexes with each flight for longer throws.', 'Provides a softer feel on your pup’s mouth with a rubber pyramid structure.', 'Unique EZ Grip design that makes it easier to pick up.', 'Comes in bright, fun colors for increased visibility.']
reviews: [Excellent fetch toy for the rough and tough K9. Stimulates the K9 mind — NO chance of your dog ever being bored— sit, stay, WATCH — FREE to run and catch the flight — retrieve — reward!, This is a great frisbee, and it’s easy for my girls to pick up off of the ground, but it is not durable as the blue rubber pieces ripped almost immediately. Others have posted pictures of what mine looks like as well, if it was more durable then it’d be 5 stars!, After the initial throw of the toy, my pup retrieved it and in route back to me, she shook her head a few times in excitement of this awesome toy. Well that head shake caused about in inch tear in one of the corners. After a few more throws, it was completely ripped. So overall got about 7 minutes of play out of it. I will admit the middle lining is really cool and it flies really well. It does still fly after the tear, but still torn. I have a aus. cattle dog/lab mix. About 45 lbs, and while yes she is a chewer and can destroy a toy in about 6 seconds if it is one of those plush toys. That is when she is chewing. Not fetching. Every other Chuckit! product I own (dozens) have lasted months, I have a German Shepherd pup going on 8 months old. He loves the Kong Flyer, but it doesn't fly very far and it is hit or miss on it's flying abilities. I went to my local pet store and they recommended the Chuckit! Fetch Flight. It was an amazing flyer. Had plenty of airtime, so once I released him from heel he could chase after it and still catch it mid-air! Only problem is the EZ Grips made a perfect location for him to chew as he returned the toy. Only lasted two play sessions before he got through on one of the rubber sections. In total lasted less than 12 hours., My dog had the rubber chewed off this toy five minutes after opening., Didn’t even last a minute an hour with my senior boy. Would not recommend., My girl loves the Heliflights that are no longer sold, so I got her this one. Great fetch toy, a little on the heavy side, but great. If she doesn't keep playing with this one, I am lost at what to get her.]

title: Chuckit! Ring Flight Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Help keep your furry friend active and healthy with Chuckit! Ring Flight Dog Toy! This entertaining toy is made of the same durable, natural rubber as the Chuckit! title: ZippyPaws Floaterz Turtle Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Make exercise and playtime easy and fun with the ZippyPaws Floaterz Turtle Dog Toy. Go aquatic with your furry pal while still giving him the squeakability he loves, thanks to its crescent-shaped squeakers that squeak even when wet! Its durable design is ideal for long fetch sessions on or off the water, since it’s reinforced with dense fabrics, strong border webbing, and tear-resistant stitching with exclusive Z-Stitch Technology. It’s the ideal playtime solution that’s easy to grab and take anywhere, including the beach, pool, or your favorite spot—it even squeaks perfectly in snow! Plus, water-loving pet parents everywhere will adore it as a special doggie gift.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', '

                        See all items by ZippyPaws
']
key_benefits: ['Built to float and squeak even when wet, making it ideal for the pool, beach, or even snow.', 'Extra-durable with cross-stitching, strong border webbing, and tear-resistant, exclusive Z-Stitch Technology.', 'Contains two crescent-shaped squeakers and is lightweight for games of fetch.', 'Stuffed head for cuddling during dry, quiet times, and comes in different characters to match your pup’s personality.', 'Soft yet durable fabric is gentle on dog’s teeth and gums.']
reviews: [My girls LOVE this toy! It is their favorite. Like others have stated, it is not "durable". But with that being said, it is not a CHEW TOY. My girls know that this is a pool toy and a pool toy ONLY. So they play fetch in the pool with it but are not allowed to have it when they are not in the pool. With those rules in mind, the toy lasts us a couple of weeks. By that time, it has definitely earned its retirement. My girls fetch it, and when one gets it before the other, the slower one then tries to take it away from the faster one and it becomes "Tug-o-War: Pool Edition". But as long as they love them as much as they do, I will keep purchasing. A busy Black Mouth Cur is a happy Black Mouth Cur, Material was not durable. My dog <13 pounds was able to chew through it before we were even able to bring it to the beach. Lasted about 1 hour before it tore., This toy floats great! My dog loves it. Don’t leave this toy out for your dog to rip up. ONLY USE IT FOR THE WATER!, My dog loved to play with this toy. Normally this brand is really good with making toys that she can't destroy but she was able to to break this toy in a week. Normally her toys last her months at a time so I am a little disappointed, My boy is excited to swim when this little green toy comes out. Seems durable so far. Several squeakers and floats well., Our Golden Retriever, 16 monhs old , had it torn apart in 10 minutes, the floater tubes & all., This is a great water toy. However it can be chewed up in 30 seconds by a my goldendoodle! But hours of play in the pool and its good as new.. I put it away when pool time is over., Hasn't been near water, but we live in a woods and zippy has been shown a lot of trees. Annie (sweet pea) loves to use the head squeaker to talk to us whenever we are trying to have a conversation or on the phone. She loves to join in., It completely lost its squeak as soon as it got wet. Chewed up quickly, Both my goldens love jumping in the pool for this and the other ZippyPaws FLoaterz. I just wish they were more durable. My dogs love to chew on them but the toys aren't tough enough. They've already destroyed the duck and the shark and walrus are torn. Strictly use for fetching only.]

descriptions:

It includes an Amphibious Bumper, Zipflight and three-pack of Amphibious Balls to take with you and your pup on your next trip to the pool, beach or lake. The Bumper serves as an ideal toy for interactive play whether your paw-tner enjoys a game of fetch or tug-o-war. The Zipflight features an aerodynamic disc shape and is perfect for long-distance games of fetch along with the Amphibious Balls. All of these playthings feature durable canvas to withstand rough play and float so they will not get lost in the water. Get your companion active with the Chuckit! Amphibious Fetch Dog Toy Kit.', 'Chuckit! Amphibious Bumper Medium, Chuckit! Zipflight Medium, Chuckit! Amphibious Balls (3) pack.', '

', '

key_benefits: ['Amphibious toy kit that features multiple playthings designed for water-loving pups.', 'Includes an Amphibious Bumper, Zipflight and 3-pack of Amphibious Balls to take to the pool, beach or lake.', 'Bumper is ideal for interactive play whether your paw-tner enjoys a game of fetch or tug-o-war.', 'Zipflight and Amphibious Balls are perfect for long-distance games of fetch with your furry friend.', 'All of the toys are made of durable canvas to withstand rough play and float so they will not get lost in water.']

title: Chuckit! Classic Launcher Dog Toy, Color Varies, Original
descriptions:
["Go long. No, really long. Really really long! With the Chuckit! Classic Ball Launcher, you'll easily be able to throw three times as far as normal, and without ever bending over or touching a slobbery ball again. Grab the comfortable handle, press down on the ball, and let it fly. You'll wear Fido out in no time! Perfect for the dog park and wide open spaces. Not so great for studio apartments.", 'Ships in a variety of random and fun colors!', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off. Use only standard tennis balls or Chuckit! Brand balls manufactured for use with this product. High speed flying balls can cause injury to animals and people. Do not aim or throw directly at people or animals. Be alert, the ball may travel in unanticipated directions. Not for indoor use.', 'Pair this Classic Launcher with the Breathe Right Fetch Ball 2-Pack toy or the Breathe Right Fetch Ball toy.', '

                        See all items by Chuckit!
']
key_benefits: ['Includes one ball for hours of fun with your pup.', 'Exercise your buddy while saving your arm.', 'Hands- free pickup so you don’t have to touch anymore doggy slobber.', 'Features an ergonomic handle for ultimate comfort and control.', 'Made of durable lightweight flexible plastic that fits any medium 2.5 inch Chuckit! ball.']
reviews: [This ball launcher is longer than the previous Chuckit! that I have and I like it better because of that. It's a simple device and works like it's supposed to. It essentially extends the length of my throwing arm and makes it possible for me to really sling a tennis ball a long way, giving my Airedale a lot of fun exercise. Like other Chuckit! launchers, it also makes it easy for me to pick up a slimy, muddy ball without having to touch it! I've tried using one of the ball "guns", but this is much better (and cheaper)., My dogs LOVE this toy and the balls are the only indestructible balls I've found for strong chewers! I DO wish you'd mark the launchers Small-Med-Large to match the ball sizes. I ordered this one to replace one my GSD chewed up but our balls are all Large. I couldn't tell from the description that this one is Size Medium, so couldn't use it and ended up donating to our local shelter with new balls. Just make it easier to order by size, please. Otherwise, it's an awesome toy for dogs with "ball drive"!!, The ball is a bit hard for our puppy baby now, but as he grows I’m sure we will have much fun with it. The construction is well made with sturdy strong plastic so I think it will last and last. Like the bright neon colored ball and the blue tosser seems to be made strong. Sure will aid in a day’s fun. Can’t wait!, We have a very active Schnoodle that loves to run and loves to be chased. Our granddaughters throw the ball with this launcher so the dog runs fast and they try to outrun him. It wears them all out, which my husband and I greatly appreciate some days! It is well made and should last a long while. Even with the "abuse" it gets from the kids., After two months of use, I can safely say my Aussie shepherd pup loves this! She will chase repeatedly and with my bad shoulder, this makes it incredibly easy. I even learned to throw with my opposite arm. It includes one tennis ball, but I bought the 2pk of rubber balls which have good bounce and make it more fun. If not for the stifling heat we’d be playing right now. Though she’s giving me the eye right now., Gracie loves this toy. Allows me to throw the ball a LOT further than normal. Gracie did destroy the heavier orange ball that came with it, but it works fine with tennis balls or replacement balls. Recommended., This is the best product for playing fetch with our fury babies. I have back issues, so this is very handy picking up the tennis ball and throwing it. I would highly recommend getting one, you won't regret it!, We have a 2 year old German Shephard/supposedly Black Lab. mix, (heavier on the Shephard), who's favorite activity is "Playing Fetch" with her ball... Insistently. However, my bad shoulder and back, limited how much I could play with her. Then I saw "Chuckit". I bought the standard wand and ball. Knowing how quick the ball might get lost in our heavily wooded, semi-rural yard, I bought a set of additional balls, and a set of Glow in the Dark balls too, for nighttime fun. Good thing I did. What I didn't know when ordering, was the ball with the wand, is a tennis ball, our dog's bite destroys tennis balls with the first bite. Also what I didn't realize when ordering, the set of Tough Balls I bought, The worst tennis ball to date. It did not last one single play session. Good thing i have other balls that fit the launcher already. Very poor quality even for a tennis ball, I have a wimpy throwing arm, the chuck it! Helps me thrown AT LEAST 5 times farther than I could without it! Have purchased this multiple times, since my dogs think it’s a chew toy if I don’t secure it after play!]

title: Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Dog Toy
descriptions:
['With the Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Dog Toy, you’ll get way more throwing power than ever before. You can launch tennis balls up to 50 feet in the air without wearing out your arm way before your pup even breaks a sweat. This high-powered Tennis Ball Blaster has a safety release mechanism and is easy to operate, so the whole family can play. After your faithful friend returns with the ball, you won’t have to touch it to pick it up—just use the end of the launcher and you’re ready to go. The Tennis Ball Blaster works with any standard tennis balls or you can use the Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Replacement Tennis Balls.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'The Medium and Large Tennis Ball Blasters work with any standard tennis balls or you can use the Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Replacement Tennis Balls.', '

                        See all items by Nerf Dog
']
key_benefits: ['Propels balls up to 50 feet in the air for a fun way to play with your dog in the park or in your own backyard.', 'Comes with a safety release mechanism that’s easy to operate, plus it has no exposed moving parts. making it safe for the whole family.', 'No need to touch the ball to pick it up—simply use the end of the launcher and avoid a slobbery mess.', 'Uses Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Replacement Tennis Balls or any standard tennis balls in the Medium and Large Blasters.', 'Interactive toy provides excitement and a great workout for your dog while being safe and easy for you!']
reviews: [We love it more than our dog! I was very excited to get this toy for my ADD husband, who gets bored throwing the ball to the dog. He loved it and was testing it out in the house, lol! One of our dogs doesn't like the noise it makes, and is not a huge fan, but it's perfect for our hyper active pitt-mix! Our arms don't get tired, but he does chasing the ball all day. I do wish it came with an extra ball (if you lose that one that comes with it, smaller, standard tennis balls do fit, but not as well)., Australian Shepherd Approved. Nuff said? We've used this thing way more than a year, and more times a day than I would try to count. I've shot this blaster so many times a day for so many months I have tennis elbow so...watch out. Change up the hand with which you pull the trigger. I didn't. Didn't even realize I was going south til I woke up one day South!, I like Nerf products but not for dogs. Well, at least not for my pooch who has a serious bite. Balls lasted maybe 15 minutes before they were shredded. Also, launcher does not launch as advertised. Better off spending the money on a good sturdy ball and toss it around the old fashion way., My 6 year old couldn’t get the ball out so he tried to pull it out... his hand was super stuck. The screws don’t open it completely and my husband had to cut it apart. Why wouldn’t you be able to take it apart?! It was a wonderful way to be woken up this am., My dog Ramon is obsessed with this gun! His first one lasted about 7 months with using it easily 100 times a DAY! The only reason we bought a second was the rubber band snapped from over use! We’ve also gifted it to a few ball loving pups!, This is so much fun for the dogs. They LOVED it and now that it broke (only a few months after getting it) fetch just isn't the same. I haven't taken it apart to figure it out but it seems like the spring or band inside that launches the ball snapped in half., My dogs LOVE this toy! I just wish it would shoot the ball farther. Also the chunk it balls fit! Which is great if your dogs are hard on balls! Tennis balls rarely last more than a day., I bought this for my husband as something fun to try with our ball centric dogs. He used it for exactly 5 throws and the trigger stopped working. Chewy customer service was great. Full refund and best of all they didn’t make me send it back. I can throw it away., My 3yr old Shepherd mix loves this ball shooter!! Literally can’t contain his excitement even when you just pick it up. Great way to get them to learn fetch play. My only concern is that I have purchased 4 of them over 3 years because they broke from so much use. However for the price I will keep buying it because I have a very sad dog when it breaks and he waits for the new one to be delivered! Lol, This is the best toy ever! Our German Shepherd puppy, Panzer, is a 7 month old 70 lb fireball. He has always loved retrieving tennis balls so when I saw this blaster I had to get it. I read the reviews and some are negative regarding the noise and operation of the blaster. I only have positive things to say - it is not loud, it is so easy to use, and it is saving my arm from throwing the ball over and over. Panzer immediately figured out the trajectory of the ball and looks out into the yard expectantly - sometimes catching it in midair. My husband thinks I like the blaster more than Panzer (I do!). I HIGHLY recommend this blaster. We use it several times a day, it is easy to use, it ]

title: Chuckit! Junior Launcher Dog Toy, Color Varies
descriptions:
["Play area too small for the classic Launcher? Now there's one suitable for smaller parks and yards. The Chuckit! Junior Ball Launcher is perfect for pups who just don't like to run as far, or lose focus when they're too far away. With the 19-inch long Launcher, you can fling a ball twice as far as you can with your arm alone, without the slobbery mess.", 'Ships in a variety of random and fun colors!', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Pair this Junior Launcher with the Breathe Right Fetch Ball 2-Pack toy or the Breathe Right Fetch Ball toy.', '

                        See all items by Chuckit!
']
key_benefits: ['Comes with one Chuckit! ball', 'Exercise your dog for hours while saving your arm', 'No more hands full of dog slobber', 'Lightweight, durable design fits comfortably in your hand', 'Use with all medium Chuckit! balls']
reviews: [My dog's full sized Chuckit was lost on a trip. Since I have a fenced yard and the ball sometimes is launched over the fence, I decided to get the Junior which does not launch as far. The lip directs the ball the ground . . .about 6 feet in front of me! Very disappointing. I ended up buying a full sized one to replace it. I do not recommend the Junior for anyone. Anyone can bounce the ball 6 feet away with their hand!, This makes playing "fetch" easier on owners, but the desription is confusing. There's no reason for this to be designated as "toy" or "junior", unless the owner/thrower is very short. The purpose of using it is to prevent having to bend to pick up a ball, but the "toy" or "junior" size is too short! The bigger the "dog" the longer the handle, so if you want the longer handle, order as if for a larger dog., We have (2) Chuckits, (1) 18" long, (1) 26". This one is so short, there is no throwing power: the ball simply bounces down in front of you but behind (not beyond) even the smallest canine. Do not purchase this size, (could not find length in product description but that may be my oversight) - it will be a waste of your $ and a big disappointment if you've not used the product in the past., I have two 10 month old pups and they both really enjoy running after tennis balls, this chuckit is a great way to give them maximum exercise., Should have gotten one of these years ago!! I have owned dogs my whole life! It is amazing how this device saves the arm and shoulder! Makes throwing balls so much easier for me and my dogs!, I can fling the ball about twice as far with this launcher which gives my dog a lot of exercise. The best part is when he brings it back and drops in on the ground I can pick the ball up with the launcher and not touch the spit covered ball with my hands. So I can sit out on the back porch and relax while giving my dog a great work out., The plastic molded product has changed, it has sharp edges, the plastic is weaker, the style of the launcher has changed and after trying it for a couple of days I decided to throw it out. I suggest going to the pet store and view one and see if it's like the old version. I'm sorry they changed their product. Not Chewy's fault., Disappointed. The ball holder part cracked within a half hour of light play, wasn’t aggressive or hard throwing and did t hit the ground and the ball holder cracked. ., I love this toy and so does my doggie. We had a chuck it in the past and would lose track of time when we'd take a trip to the park. This size works much better thou in our backyard. Helps shave off some extra energy and gets her nice and calm for the night. Would def recommend this toy to any pet parent! Get an extra set of balls. Especially if your dog is known to chew thru toys in a heartbeat, lol., the word Junior in this item made me think that it was going to be a smaller ball then the average tennis ball and it was not.]

title: Frisco Ball Launcher
descriptions:
['Take playtime outside with the Frisco Ball Launcher. Now you can toss that ball further with less effort so your pup can get his fill of fetch! The long, curved, flexible handle lets you throw the ball at a greater distance to give energetic dogs the added exercise they need, while saving your arm. The ergonomic handle makes it comfy to use so you can keep up with your fetch-loving friend game after game. The ball is included so you can get to fetching without waiting. Plus, no more slobber hands—the hands-free ball pickup action lets you dodge the drool.', '
                No toy is indestructible. Supervise your pet when using since small parts can present a choking hazard or internal blockage. Discontinue use if the toy is damaged. Keep out of reach of children 
', '

                        See all items by Frisco
']
key_benefits: ['Ball launcher and ball set provides hours of fun playing fetch with your pooch.', 'Long, curved, flexible handle lets you toss the ball further while saving your arm, so you can keep up with your pup.', 'Ergonomic handle helps prevent hand fatigue for longer play sessions.', 'No more picking up drool-drenched balls with hands-free pickup.', 'Perfect for energetic dogs that need extra exercise outdoors.']
reviews: [Whom ever came up with this idea is a genius. I don't have to touch the ball, my hands dont get dirty from the dirt in the park nor my dogs saliva. Also i doingt strain my back having to keep bending down and picking up the ball., We go through tennis balls playing daily, this launcher was ordered to save my back. It cannot accommodate a normal size tennis ball, it will fit into the launcher but doesn’t come out. I have tried two days, I will once more before I toss it. Hopefully someone reads this review and doesn’t purchase because I didn’t read any!, Works as advertised. Great for my son who is in a wheelchair. He does not have to bend over to get the ball to be able to play fetch with the dogs, Normal tennis balls are slightly too large forcing you to keep buying the balls that came with this I guess., This little thrower allows you to launch a tennis balls onto the next block. Great price, lots of fun., My GSD and I had a great run with the chuck it launcher for years and I ordered this thinking I’d save a couple bucks. It’s not worth it! My pup can play fetch for hours so quality is important. The plastic end makes it hard to keep from sliding (no rubber grip) and its kind of uncomfortable if you need to really throw it far. Spend the extra $ to get the chuck it brand!, My 1 1/2 year old lab has endless energy. This toy helps zap it, Helps me be able to play with him and not injure my shoulder, I didn’t realize how much I’d appreciate this ball launcher. By just applying a little pressure the head picks up any standard size tennis ball. And a flick of the wrist sends it far enough for a good fetch. Definitely saving me from some back and shoulder pain. #ChewyTeamRated, This has made playing fetch with Remi easier and more fun for her. I can throw the ball farther out and she actually brings it back to me to throw again! I think she approves of it too!]

key_benefits: ['Great way to exercise your dog without straining your arm or exhausting yourself.', 'Allows you to throw 2 to 3 times further, allowing your dog to fetch far and burn off energy.', 'Hands-free pickup means no more touching slobbery balls and getting your hands dirty.', 'Made from a durable and lightweight flexible plastic with an ergonomic handle for comfort and control.', 'Made in the USA and comes with one Chuckit! reviews: [The original "Chuckit" was great. I just broke the second one I purchased, still have the first one. I need to purchase a new one. Unfortunate,. it appears it is not available in the LARGE 3 inch ball size. So now I am forced to shop elsewhere. I also have noticed that my regular dog foods are "not available at this time".. which has been that way for almost a year now. So.... I guess I will have to shop elsewhere. Sad because this was a great service. Goodbye Chewy., The medium Chuckit is a great size for my 60lb dog. The handle is sturdy, but the ball cracked in half after our first playtime! He’s not a stronger than normal chewer, and plays with regular tennis balls every day. Was a little disappointed., We got this to keep at our home for our “grand dog” when she comes to visit. She’s a border collie and loves to run and chase the ball. Great launching action and goes really far...she loves it., The thrower is fantastic! However, the ball that came with it??? Broke in less than a week. Sooo now I have to head to the store to purchase replacement balls so my Emma can continue to have fun, don't love the tennis ball, but the launcher is awesome!! Lasts for years if taken care of and works great with the other options they have!, I love how this item can sure save on your arm for throwing the ball, the problem is my Boxer had it for maybe 3 hrs & already chewed a hole in the ball. Well of course he loves the ball so wont let it go obviously it wont launch as far with a hole in it ha,ha. It will work with regular tennis balls so that is what I am using, I dont buy the dog tennis balls cuz they never last. The real ones last alot longer with my strong jawed little guy., I always appreciate all the staffs. They go extra mill to serve the customer. I am customer and be back. Thank you Chewy, Although my dog doesn’t fetch he will chase after the ball. It’s good exercise., I purchase my third Chuckit. My dog tore up the ball first time I used it. Good thing I had the ball from the one I bought last year. This last one is junk. Don’t waste your money., I had a chuckit - lasted for a long time, finally cracked, bought another one called sport launcher. It is not the same as the first one and I hate it. I can't control the direction of the ball!]

descriptions:

With standard and mini-sized options for both the iFetch too and iFetch mini, these replacement balls ensure the fun never has to end. They are felted just like regular tennis balls, but the special design is made for dogs with a non-abrasive material that goes easier on their teeth. Just drop one in the automatic launcher, and let the fun begin! Chances are your dog might lose track of one or two, so these replacement packs are an easy way to ensure the fetch never stops.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. reviews: [Brand new, doesn't work. Had difficulty reaching a live human for customer service. Sent an email and got an automated reply. I don't want my money back per se, I just want one that works. Chewy.com however, got the item to me quickly as usual. LOVE Chewy!, These balls are just the right size for the iKETCH that does not throw the balls out. The balls are dropped into the middle and come out several different sides. Dogs have to run to catch them. My dog loves them!, Destroyed within an hour. The dog loves them but they break easily and get stuck in the launcher., These balls are the perfect size for my Pomeranian and Chihuahua. They work great in the iFetch toy., My dog loves his ifetch, but he broke all these balls in a week. They are no different than any other tennis balls. I would be very interested if they came out with a stronger ball. I'm willing to put money on that., my dog is obsessed with chasing these balls that come out of the automatic ball thrower. i use it when i need to wear her out (which is often!). she loves these. they do tend to get covered with saliva so i replenish them often., My Westies love these, in or out of the ball machine they go to these balls first! I don’t leave these in the toy box, they have almost choked a time or two because they are so small, must be observed. Small for small dogs only. The small ones are smaller than a golf ball in size., I've been waiting for these. The balls can be used in the I fetch shooter or seperate. Little ones favorite indoor activity., where wrong size for ball thrower I have ...too small, Great size, terrible construction- our 20 pound Cavapoo loves them and demolishes them in an hour- so they will not be reordered.]

descriptions:

Pro Launcher, you'll easily be able to throw three times as far as normal, and without ever bending over or touching a slobbery ball again. key_benefits: ['Includes one ball for hours of fun with your pup', 'Exercise your buddy while saving your arm', 'Hands- free pickup so you don’t have to touch anymore doggy slobber', 'Features an ergonomic handle for ultimate comfort and control', 'Made of durable lightweight flexible plastic']
reviews: [The chuck it is great. Fits the need for a large dog. I chucked the ball a maybe 10 times- and it split down the middle. Design and QC issue probably. We continued to play with it for a day and make the most of it...it's ruined. Looking for a 3.5 LED nylon ball to chuck. Something solid with option to replace battery when it dies., First time I used the chucker it was difficult to get the right throw. Something changed from they way they were made originally. Just can't get the right distance and I have used these length chuckers 100's of times. The balls were different in that they were hard inside with a felt outside. First time I ever saw that and after (1) use the ball cracked in half and I have a lab who DOES NOT chew the balls like some dogs do. This was a first! Very disappointing., This Chuckit is shorter than my other one - which is what i was looking for. It works okay compared to the other one- but its cup is angled in a way that overhand throwing puts the ball short, directly into the ground. To get a longer toss you have to throw low, from the side., The reviews about the ball this comes with are correct, it was destroyed the first day. But the thrower itself is awesome! Our doodle loves to run FAR and brings the ball back every time. This thrower saves my husband’s shoulder and even I can throw the ball far with it. We upgraded to the whistler ball and he loves it! He chews on it before dropping it for the next run and it’s held up to it just fine, we’ve had it 3 months., I have multiple Chuckit ball tossers. This one is bad!! There is too much of a curve on the arm & tosses the ball to the ground near you. We also had to file down the top curve because it kept the ball too tight., My dog loves to fetch and whenever he sees us pick this up, he gets so excited. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the tennis ball that comes with the launcher did not last long. I would recommend ordering the rubber chuck it balls at the same time you order the chuck it launcher., My girl loves to run and this is a great idea, but the ball that comes with it it terrible. It fell about after a few throws. I also bought the harder rubber ball. That has a great bounce. Unfortunately, it has such a great bounce that it bounced into the neighbors bushes and we have yet to find it., The Pro launcher does help throw balls farther, but it's too much. I have to launch as far as I can with the regular launcher for my dog, so I was hoping that the pro launcher would make it easier on my arm, but this launcher goes way too far. It's very durable and flexible and the handle is more comfortable than the regular launcher. It's way too long and a pain to carry around, even just from the car to the park. Also, it comes with a regular tennis ball, which is pretty much useless to our dog (it's destroyed in one day). You'd assume that a Pro launcher would come with something more durable, and Chewy mistakenly says that this comes with an Ultra ball in the product Q&A, disappointing, Perfect gadget for those with less than athletic throwing abilities. My dogs love it! I don’t get slobber all over my hands! I also purchased the glow in the dark balls for the chuck it to play at night., Well. To start with...I have a power chewer Doodle who absolutely loves the Chuckit Regular and amazingly doesn't destroy these smaller durable balls immediately. With the Pro Launcher, which I mistakenly thought would throw farther and be even more durable, had the large oversized tennis nall destroyed after our first outing. Now have a launcher, no longer or more useful than the Regular Model, unable to accept the durable smaller Chuckit balls. I wouldn't bother with another set of large tennis balls-useless. An oversize launcher without durable launchees (unless I gather large rocks to toss). Stick with the Regular Model!]

descriptions:

It’s perfect for when you’re away or busy doing other things—like getting his dinner ready—while ensuring he gets all the mental and physical exercise that he needs. All you have to do is plug it in, choose your launching distance and then drop in a mini ball. Soon your dog will learn how to drop it himself, which stimulates his mind and allows for totally independent play.', '(3) pack of iFetch Mini Tennis Balls, AC Adapter for 110 and 220 volts (batteries not included).', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. key_benefits: ['Automatic ball launcher is designed specifically for small to medium sized dogs.', 'Comes with three mini tennis balls that are 1.6-inches in diameter. Easier for small mouths to fetch!', 'Launches the ball 10, 20 or 30 feet, which can easily be changed with the push of a button.', 'Operates almost silently with a streamlined plastic design with rubber feet keep it in place.', 'Measures 10.5" x 7" x 7.5" high, with a 6.5" diameter ball return cone at the top and a 1-5/8" diameter ball launching hole.']
reviews: [We got this for our chihuahua terrier mix that loves fetch. He was so excited he peed on it when our other dog went near it! We used it in our hallway when we had a smaller house and no backyard on the low setting and it did great. We now use it in our large backyard and it works just as well. Only problem is some of the balls get frayed from use and then the launcher gets stuck or the balls won't launch. I use a sweater shaver thing to cut the extra stuff off but sometimes it still gets stuck. Still the best thing ever., VERY unhappy with my purchase. No fault to Chewy, but the iFetch did not work, spoke to customer service at iFetch who gave me an incorrect email address. Have since sent request to the proper address and gotten NO reply beyond an automated acknowledgment. I WANT A WORKING iFETCH!, I got this for my little dog Walter. He loves it. I haven't trained him to put the ball in the hole yet, but we are working on it. He is so at the ready, staring at the hole that the ball will come out of and when it does, he is off. Great for exercise for him and so fun to watch him., My dogs love this and get so excited to use it. But the motor dies really fast. I'm on my 2nd (the last was a gift as I wouldn't have gotten another). True to timing with the first, after about 9 mos of using it ~3 times a week for an hour, the motor just dies. This is a really, really expensive toy to die so quickly., This is fun toy no doubt. The down fall and at $65+ for the actual dispenser, I haven't been able to find balls that are compatible for the smaller unit. The replacement balls are $11-$12 for a sleeve of 4 mini balls. That's way out of line for tennis balls. I found that my Boston Terrier is biting down on the balls and cracking them., We have 2 Cavaliers both about 18 months they love the Ifetch so much!, This is an awesome toy, however the popping sound startles my dog so he will not get close enough to drop the balls back in. It is probably best for a large dog. There was a different style available that I think would probably be much better for small dogs. He does love chasing the balls so I will definitely continue to encourage him to use it by himself., This dog has a lot of energy and loves playing with toys., I was checking on this automatic ball launcher dog toy, and on the original website from the manufacturer if the enclosed balls are not working; use a squash ball the same size, and it works much better. The manufacturer said that any ball the same size would work. I want to purchase one for my little dog, and am leary because of the reviews for the ball not being able to launch and getting stuck, but was wondering if anyone has tried the squash ball?, The device is very well built and the concept is great. However, the balls become fuzzy within the first minutes of use and within a few dozen throws, the balls stick and won’t go through the machine. The ball fuzz will eventually become wrapped around the mechanism causing it to cease functionality. I’ve purchased both the iFetch and iDig. Both were unable to be used within 30-45 days. It really feels like a company that manufactures products and sell them without running it through any real-world testing.]

reviews: [Although my puppy loved it, it wasn’t durable enough for him. He’s still in an aggressive teething phase so it’s hard to find toys that he won’t destroy. Don't waste your money., The seams all broke apart within a week of having it and our lab was only 12lbs and played only occasionally with it, This is a record for a toy being destroyed the fastest. My dog loves this toy but it just doesn't last like it should., M puppy had this chewed apart within 2 hours, the wings are every thin material and the body also]

title: Nerf Dog Force Grip Trackshot Launching Duck Dog Toy
descriptions:
["Keep your furry friend entertained for hours with the Nerf Dog Force Grip Trackshot Launching Duck Dog Toy. The super-strong toy is Nerf Dog's specialty line of durable plush toys that stand up to your dog's teeth, thanks to the sturdy woven nylon exterior with tear-resistant polyurethane rubber coating. The medium Trackshot Duck Launcher will entertain you and your dog for hours on end, without hurting your shoulder. The elastic slingshot sends the attached plush toy hurtling through the air up to 75 feet, providing great exercise for your furry best friend. It's fun that will last, too—the trackshot arrowhead has special tear-resistant coating and stitching that's three times stronger than standard plush.", 'Created especially for paw-some games of fetch and catch, this toy is not designed to be a chew toy. key_benefits: ['Durable plush toy made of a sturdy woven nylon exterior with tear-resistant polyurethane rubber coating for a long-lasting toy.', 'This launching duck toy will keep you and your dog entertained for hours while you play outside.', 'Promotes exercise and helps eliminate boredom—elastic slingshot catapults the attached plush toy through the air up to 75 feet.', 'Made with a special tear-resistant coating and stitching, which makes this thrilling toy three times stronger than standard plush.', 'The 12-inch duck is made for all breed sizes and all life stages with durable, lightweight material engineered for fetching, so it can stand up to your rough-and-tumble tosses.']
reviews: [We have a medium sized Australian lab Mix. I've known a Nerf toys to be a pretty good toy for humans. But for dogs? You guys are going to have to step up your efforts. My dog Boodee was able to rip through this launch duck and rip apart all the stuffing and spread it all over the house in two days. I think you should test your toys a little better at least if they're for a dog and if you really want to test them send them to me just send me free samples and I'll let you know how long they last with my dog I don't know how to tell you to make him tougher that's your job but I'd be more than happy to have my dog test them out for you just because I think nurses a good name and it's good for kids, Of all the toys I bought for my Australian Labradoodle puppy, this one is the best. It's her favorite as well...loves to retrieve and shake it hard. It's holding up well under her sharp teeth. I'm not sure it can fly as far as they say, but it does go all the way across our living area and nothing gets damaged in the process. It would probably fly further out doors with the wind at its back. The first time I tried to make it fly, it went about 5 feet (lol), but with practice I'm getting perfect., We use this in the pool as a fetch toy. It holds up to Abby and stays afloat!, Completely destroyed in 2 hours by my Australian Shepherd. Not for a chewer., This toy looks amazing at first then I started to use it and first of all the toy said it will launch 75 feet on the box, but that it not true at all maybe 10 feet on a good day. Also the knot at the end of the duck came totally unwound after the 3 pulls., Purchased for 14 week old Aussie doodle puppy. NOT super durable. A few hours of play last night on Christmas and it’s toast! Chewed holes in it and stuffing coming out. Less than a half day of use. Tempted to send this crud back. DONT buy!, My Cacapoo loves this toy . I fling it into the bushes like a real bird and he goes crazy, This toy is well made and launches well with not too much effort which is important cause I’m not good at pitching. However, my lab is just not interested in it, he prefers a nice round ball which he will chase forever., Unfortunately this ended up in the garbage after 10 minutes of play time due to poor stitching of the launching part after a few pulls the stitches started to pull out causing it to tear more and more each time. A real disappointment especially since she really liked it., Just bought this toy for my 45 lb German Sheperd mix. It lasted less than 15 minutes. I love the Nerf dog toys, we have a ton of them . So for this to say its extra durable and for it to be destroyed so quickly I was very dissatisfied and disappointed ;(]

title: Hyper Pet K9 Kannon K2 Tennis Ball Launcher Interactive Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Take aim and catapult your flinging fun to a whole new level with the Hyper Pet K9 Kannon K2 Tennis Ball Launcher Interactive Dog Toy. This innovative ball launching toy features hands-free ball pick-up, so you don’t have to get your hands slimy before effortlessly hurling the ball 75 feet across the field for hours of fetching fun and great exercise for your high-energy pal. It even comes with one of Hyper Pet’s own specially-designed balls that’s been engineered with your precious pup’s safety in mind. The ball is made of Grade A rubber so it’s paw-sitively safe on his teeth and doesn’t contain any harmful coatings or gases.', '(1) regular Hyper Pet ball.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Replacement Regular Hyper Pet Balls are available in Green, Orange and Pink.', 'Also available as a mini-size K9 Kannon K2 Toy for small breed dogs.', '

                        See all items by Hyper Pet
']
key_benefits: ['Launches tennis balls for spirited games of fetch with your pup.', 'Easy to operate with quick-trigger, seamless launching that really keeps your dog moving.', 'Adjust the distance using the handy lever to suit the size of your play area and your dog’s fitness level.', 'Lets you pick up the balls hands-free for all of the fun with none of the slobber.', 'Comes with one K-9 Kannon and one Hyper tennis ball to shoot for loads of fetching fun!']
reviews: [Keeping my Golden happy is second to keeping her healthy! Awesome ball launcher does both! Just the sight of this gun creates wagging tails and tapping paws. Shoots the balls farther than I can throw them and this is my replacement from another brand. The last one lasted over 2 years, this one is built more sturdy and gets used daily. Our Golden is not hyper crazy, but will chase balls as long as you shoot them. Creates great exercise in a fun way!, This is my 4 yr old golden's favorite toy. He's been playing with them for most of his life and insists that we go in the yard to shoot about 5 times a day. I sit, he drops the tennis ball in my lap and he's ready to rock! 10 minutes is usually enough to wear him out...that is until the next time. This is great for weight control and muscle development! Of course it has to be replaced from time to time so we always keep a backup gun in the garage. PLEASE DON'T EVER DISCONTINUE THIS TOY!!!, I'm purchasing a new one today as finally wore the other one out. If you want to truly get distance, I recommend buying good pressurized tennis balls. They shoot farter and also bounce better. My dog loves to look over her shoulder when running to get it on the fly or at least on the first bounce. Fun to watch her leap for it., My boyfriend got this for our dog for Christmas and it just broke last week. We use it constantly!! My dog loves playing fetch but always gets the ball all slobbery so this no-touch cannon is AWESOME! We just got a new one in the mail. My dog recognized it as soon as I pulled it out of the box!!!, This is my third different tennis ball launcher and so far, the best! The other two brands broke within 2 months. It is made very well, easy for me with arthritis to pull the handle back. It shoots a standard tennis ball farther than the other launchers I’ve had. My lab heads right for the K9 Kannon launcher every time I let her outside. It is her ultimate favorite toy!, My dog is a runner and loves to play fetch. I bought this product based on the description saying it could launch a ball up to 75 ft. I haven’t been able to reach 20ft, if I’ve reached that. Very disappointed with this purchase., Just got this ball launcher today, ( 7/8/2020 ) Tried it out and It only launches the ball around 10 feet. Also came with only 1 ball. Tried to look up my order and I’m guessing that Chewy doesn’t carry this ball launcher anymore. And I just ordered this on July 2, 2020., Beaux Bella, our Black Lab, is really lackadaisical if a ball is simply thrown, especially by Mom who throws like girl. When she hears the ratcheting sound of an impending launch from the K9 Kannon she gets sooooooo happy her behind nearly wags off. However, we do need to keep it out of sight, to the point of using different hiding places to confuse her or she will either get so excited we have to get it & play, or if it's within her reach she will bring it to us The only downside to the K9 Kannon is not being able to replace the large rubber band. It lasts quite awhile, but eventually it does need to be replaced and your only recourse is to replace the toy., We love the K9 Kannon! We have a 2 year old German Shepherd and when it's not raining we play fetch 3-4 times a day. I can sit on our swing and shoot the Kannon as long as he wants to chase it. I have tried several other devices and this has been the best by far. Only issue is the rubber band inside is not available to purchase. As often as we play, sometimes it wares out about 6 months. It usually still works but doesn't shoot nearly as far. Keep indoors when not in use as extreme heat or cold will shorten its life. New/dry balls also shoot farther. I keep 3 balls loaded in the gun just for fetch., This is the second one we have purchased. We used to have to stop throwing the ball because our arms hurt. No more. Now we can go until the dogs are tired, and, we do not have to touch the ball. Recommend highly. Just wish we could purchase the rubber bands separately.]

reviews: [I don't have to bend down to pick up a slimy ball anymore with Chuckit. I love it, and my dog loves it. I can throw the ball farther or bounce it higher without hurting my shoulder. No more bending over to grab a slimy ball off the ground., I can throw the tennis ball much farther with less effort and my dog gets a better workout. We both love it., Great to throw more distance. While this new Chuckit doesn't throw the ball any farther, the rubberized handle is much more comfortable. When you throw the ball as much as I do, this is critical!]

reviews: [Get my stuff @ Chewy. Came back looking for hyper pet's K9 Kannon. Chewy only had this one. Harsh recoil from a metal spring instead of silicone band and balls do not have the same velocity as Hyperpet., So, I bought this before I saw the bad reviews. I figured oh well whats the harm i already paid. Just a disclaimer too, we have two of the nerf brand ball shooters as well. For anyone looking for a ball shooter, I recommend the nerf gun brand in blue and orange. Those I got on sale a few yrs ago and it's truly worth it. I decided on a new one because we left our nerf ones outside in the rain amd sun and it doesnt shoot as smoothly now, but still way better than this product. I'm angry at this ball shooter, but the plastic is cheap, you can tell when you open it. The handle you pull back is cheaply made, I dont expect it to last long. The ball shoots fine for a backyard and my dog, Purchased this item to launch tennis balls for my Labrador, further then what this 63 old could throw them. This item doesn't send the balls are far as I either hoped or anticipated it would. On the plus it does save my arm when using it. Will continue shopping at Chewy because I have had good experiences before., Doesn't shoot more than maybe 40 ft. My dog looks at me as if to say seriously. Buy a chuck it cause this is useless., This launcher does not launch the ball far at all. It only went about 15 feet. Would not recommend for a big dog., My dogs LOVED this toy but I recieved it less than a month ago and the black pull back trigger has broken on this toy. I noticed it says 1 year warranty on the website. Wanting to get the toy replaced., This item was not what I read about before I purchased, did not live up to expectations. It doesn’t launch the ball very far, I can throw further!, The very first day the trigger broke, I should have read the reviews. Amazon was great about the return with immediate attention. They told me to keep, donate or throw away. I opened it, with 20+ screws holding the gun together you'd think it would be better quality, basically the black plastic parts are very brittle plastic and breaks quickly & easily. I'm trying to fix the very small parts with krazy glue., This blaster started out great! My Doxie loved it. It just gave out so easily. After like 50 launches it broke. :(, It worked but my dog was afraid of it because when you short it it makes a loud noise which disturbs my dog and now he is afraid of it I’m back to throwing as usual this just sites in the garage collecting dust]

title: Chuckit! Ultra Ring Launcher Fetch Dog Toy
descriptions:

This interactive chase and fetch toy will provide hours of playtime for you and your furry friend. Featuring a long, ergonomic handle with easy pick-up head, the toy allows you to keep playing fetch with your pal for longer. The unique topspin-infused action causes the toy to erratically bounce, zig-zag and hop on the ground like real game, engaging your dog's natural chase instincts. The ring launcher brings a new way to fetch, creating more fun, interactive way to spend time with your best friend.", 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. ']
key_benefits: ['Interactive chase and fetch toy made from rubber, so it’s safe for doggie’s mouth.', "Flying dog toy acts like an animal, bouncing, zig-zagging and hopping, waking up your dog's natural chase instincts.", 'Withstands hours of fun whether it be out in an open field or at the beach and it’s a slobber-free pick-up toy.', 'Easy throwing motion—just flick it and let your furry best friend try and catch it.', 'The ring launcher fetch toy has long, ergonomic handle with easy pick-up head, so you won’t mind playing for as long as he wants.']
reviews: [I bought it to kind of mix it up throwing things, I somehow managed to peg myself with the ring while trying to throw it. It released “late” .... once I got the hang of it, the dogs weren’t that impressed with it compared to the ball. Also like some other reviews, my one dog fetched it and had it chewed by the time I got to her to get it. So it’s okay, maybe wouldn’t buy again., Cerreta and I love this toy. The ring fling is a little more fun than the ball Chuckit because the roll and bounce of the wheel is a little more dramatic than the ball. Chuckit, make a squeaky ring!!, wish I would have researched better i thought it was a bigger flying disk that you could throw out in water. I have big dogs and hard for them to see it, Dont get me wrong, definitely a fun toy! BUT this ring only lasted about 3hrs before it was tore up., My dogs love this thing. It has always been their favorite toy to race after. Tiny learning curve figuring out how to put the ring on the stick without touching it. I have to make sure to put the ring up after we play because my dogs can chew the ring apart in minutes, not so with the ball, that they have trouble destroying., very fun toy for a prey driven dog. takes a few tries to get the motion but once you do its very fun for the dog, This isn’t a bad product but it was tougher to throw and my dog chewed up the ring in 5 minutes. My dog is a tough chewer so I choose the regular rubber tennis balls over this toy in the future. But I will say he LOVED chewing up the ring., This is the best interactive toy ever purchased. The ring goes so far, mimics a squirrel with it’s erratic bouncing. Don’t listen to reviews about it being difficult. Read the instructions and just hold it the right direction. Then it is so easy to throw and goes sooo far. Such a great alternative to tennis balls. And you can rinse it off. If you press on the inner portion of the ring with the launcher it tilts slightly and is easy to pick up hands free. Learn to use it and your pup will be eternally grateful. Even our bull dog gets involved because of her natural prey drive. This really engages all dogs, even lazy and non-retriever breeds. Buy it and you will see it’s the best money spent. , Our 1 year old pup LOVES to chase and play fetch, but nothing seemed to hold her attention for very long. That was until we came across this toy. Holy cow...this girl can run after this ring for HOURS a day, never getting bored. In the few months we've had it, it's helped us with her training and impulse control, and she comes in absolutely EXHAUSTED every time we play (which makes for nice, quiet evenings)! Our pup is a huge chewer but we don't let her chew on this toy, and it's lasted a long time with no damage, just some fading from how often we're out in the sun playing. LOVE IT!, Don't bother! Chuckit! with this Chuckit! toy. too hard to use and doesn't exactly play as well as the ball version. Stick with the ball one.]

reviews: [Does not seem to go as far as my long one but it makes her happy so that makes me Happy. title: PetSafe Automatic Ball Launcher Dog Toy
descriptions:
['The PetSafe Automatic Ball Launcher is an automatic fetching machine that can be used by dog and owner or just the dog. The automatic launcher features make independent play easy and fun, while multiple safety features protect people and pets. The launcher was designed with three motion sensors for optimal safety. A sensor located in the front keeps pets and people safe while walking in front of the launcher, while a sensor in the launch pocket keeps hands and snouts safe. There is an additional sensor to detect when a ball is in the launch pocket to initiate play. Another safety feature allows the dog to play for a full 15 minutes before going into a 15 minute rest mode so the dog does not overwork themselves. There are 6 angle and 9 distance settings to really mix up playtime or to create indoor and outdoor use. Play a short game of indoor fetch at 8 feet or go outside and stretch those legs at 30 feet. Different angles make it extra fun! Plug it in or use 6 D batteries for portable play. The PetSafe Automatic Ball Launcher is safe, fun and totally versatile! Two standard-sized tennis balls, power cord, training instructions and user manual included.', '(2) standard-sized tennis balls, power cord, training instructions and user manual', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', '

                        See all items by PetSafe
']
key_benefits: ['Features make independent play easy and fun, while multiple safety features protect people and pets', 'Designed with three motion sensors for optimal safety: sensor located in the front keeps pets and people safe while walking in front of the launcher, while a sensor in the launch pocket keeps hands and snouts safe and an additional sensor detects when a ball is in the launch pocket to initiate play', 'Safety feature allows the dog to play for a full 15 minutes before going into a 15 minute rest mode so the dog does not overwork themselves', 'Launches between 8-30 feet with 6 angle and 9 distance settings to really mix up playtime or to create indoor and outdoor use', 'Automatic Ball Launcher plays fetch with your dog while interactive features aid in training']
reviews: [I wanted to get one of these for my dogs for a long time. It is cheaply made. Doesn't launch the ball very far at all and after one use it continuously thinks a ball is in there when it isn't and launches nothing but air. If this thing were half the price Id feel more comfortable spending the money but $160+ after taxes? Its laughable. Going to return., It only works sometimes and is super inconsistent. My dog ends up as confused as me wether it will work or not and it never throws the same distance. The distance adjustments don’t even seem to change anything. Waste of money for sure, Right when my dog figured out how to use her ball launcher, it broke. It lasted for 4 days. Not worth the money at all., This is not a big dog device. Very flimsy. Gears/mechanism exposed. Not safe. When ball launches, it causes the other ball to fly out the top. Plastic is thin and brittle., Shoots very far, really strong. The 7ft motion sensor works well. Its worth the money for such a strong stable product. My aussie got the concept right away, my dane on the other hand...still figuring it out., Didn't even get to use this item as it came damaged., I love this auto ball launcher, my puppy does too, great fun for the entire family., This toy is awesome. We have a 7 year old chocolate lab who still has the energy of a puppy. She is obsessed with the ball, so this was a dream com true for her. I was also surprised at how easy it was to train her to put the ball in the toy. It is battery operated and they seem to go quickly, but that’s our only complaint., This toy is awesome! The only bad part is my dog wants to play non stop! But we are having a lot of fun with it., Not sure if it was shipping related or poor product doesn’t work and something is rattling inside]

key_benefits: ['Innovative ball launching toy catapults your fetch game to a whole new level of fun; recommended for use with toy and small breed dogs.', 'Easy-to-use toy effortlessly slings balls up to 75 feet for hours of fetching fun and great exercise for your petite pooch.', 'Hands-free operation lets you pick up retrieved balls without getting your hands slimy by simply pressing them into the barrel of the launcher.', 'Comes with one mini Hyper Pet ball made of Grade A rubber and containing no coatings or gases so it’s safe for your little dog.', 'Uses specially-designed 1.88-inch mini tennis balls; convenient two-ball storage located under barrel.']
reviews: [I used to really enjoy this companies products. I purchased a mini ball launcher similar to this one and it lasted almost two years! Then once the rubber band finally broke, I bought a new full sized canon. We were excited to play with the new toy, but after not even a few hours, the trigger snapped and the fun was over. I just purchased two new mini launcher believing the the full sized canon was too strong for its own good, but yet again, after only a few hours of play the mini canon broke. Seems that these toys must now be poorly made and no longer worth purchasing., The first day my little shih tzu was scared of this because it makes quite a noise when pulling back the plunger to load the ball and a loud click when the trigger is pulled. She would run after the ball after I faked a throw but was afraid to bring it back. I was disappointed but didn't give up as this thing is an arm saver and fun to shoot. By day 2 she had grasped the concept and accepted the noise as friendly and we now enjoy a fun play day. It will shoot smaller balls also but you have to hold the end up so the ball doesn't roll out. Also the newer the ball the further it will shoot. Its like playing tennis, older balls are less bouncy. I highly recommend this toy., I go crazy when my mom gets out the bag with the gun in it. I love to dig in the snow to find the ball. In fact I sometimes bury it again. I look beautiful with tiny snowball on my face., Our Lola Mae absolutely loves this! We have to limit her to 15 minutes each time we play or she wears herself out. She knows where we keep it, when we go by the door she goes buzerk she wants to play so bad! She loves to play ball anyway so this gives us human’s a rest on our arm from throwing the ball!, My 6mth old puppy loves this toy. She hears the clicks and knows the ball is about to come out. It doesn't matter that the ball doesn't go all that far because she is a 20lb pup. Also, the mini balls fit in her mouth and are easy for her to carry. It has been a great way to help her burn off energy and the excitement is contagious (I love to take her out and "shoot the balls"). (Her brother is 80lbs and has the larger gun with larger balls and she doesn't like the large balls - oh,and we're not quite as please with the larger gun which doesn't shoot the balls very far at all). I recommend this gun highly. Don't leave it outside (in the cold) cocked,though, because the rubber band gets loose, disappointed. I have a big dog so the balls are too small for him.., I got this for my nieces daughters dog, Susie, who loves to fetch. She loves it!, Our Pug LOVES this toy! He can play fetch until he drops! Great purchase. Well made product. I wish I could add video, of him playing fetch with it. It is fun!, My dog loves this toy, and so do I! He loves to play catch and throwing the ball all the time makes the arm tired. And the ball ends up getting slimy too. This toy takes care of both of the problems at once. And it is worth the price., Love this thing and so do my dogs. Hours of fun with it! Wears my dogs right out! And they are always wagging those tails when I get it out]

title: iFetch Too Automatic Ball Launcher Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Give your arm a break with the iFetch Too Automatic Ball Launcher Dog Toy. Designed especially for medium to large dogs, this interactive dog toy launches the ball for you! It’s perfect for when you’re away or busy doing other things—like getting his dinner ready—while ensuring he gets all the mental and physical exercise that he needs. All you have to do is plug it in, choose your launching distance and then drop in a tennis ball. Soon your dog will learn how to drop it himself, which stimulates his mind and allows for totally independent play.', '(3) Pack of iFetch Standard Tennis Balls, AC Charger for the Internal Rechargeable Battery.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Get an extra set of iFetch Tennis Balls Here', '

                        See all items by iFetch
']
key_benefits: ['Automatic ball launcher is designed specifically for medium to large sized dogs.', 'Comes with three standard-sized tennis balls, with a non-abrasive design that is gentler on teeth.', 'Launches the ball 10, 25 or 40 feet, which can easily be changed with the push of a button.', 'Operates almost silently with a streamlined plastic design with rubber feet keep it in place.', 'Excellent way to encourage both mental and physical exercise, and allows for independent play.']
reviews: [I bought this Dec 30 , 2018 . Today I’d Oct. 1 2020. It was the center of my dogs world ! He wore it out today , it tosses the ball about 6” on the highest setting . Is it worth $100.00 a year ? Raz would bark yes... me..... I just wish it lasted longer. He’s worth buying another one for ., Didn't launch nearly as far as advertised, and the balls got stuck after two or three throws, every time. Complete waste of money, We bought racquetballs to replace the tennis balls, after reading reviews & knowing how our dog likes to destroy fuzzy tennis balls. Still working on him dropping the ball into the launcher on his own, but we are training in increments: bring the ball to the launcher, nudge the ball out of my hand into the launcher, and [hopefully soon] dropping it in himself. He understands that this device will throw the balls for him, and he keeps trying to bark at it or stick his nose in the holes. It stays powered on if plugged in, but seems to go to sleep to save energy. Wakes up if a ball is dropped in. The lowest setting works well in our apartment, but we need to make sure it isn't aimed towards, My dog is enjoying the toy. It's a great idea, but my biggest problem is just the quality of the device and the balls. The first time we were using it on the 10, the ball would get stuck inside. I bumped it up to the next level and that seemed to help, but my dog already destroyed 2 of the 3 balls. Lucky I ordered a second set (which still hasn't arrived even though I ordered it a week ago....) But I will not buy any more ifetch balls., I about love chewy. They are fast and their products are great. I do have a issue with the product that I recently purchased. This is a manufacturer’s issue not chewy. I brought a ball launcher for my dog and some pieces fall off. This happens when my dog pushes it . Top ring and ring where ball shoots out falls off a lot. Other than that it’s good., Bought this product and it only worked one time. I have a very disappointed Boston Terrier. Had to return the item. They promised me another one and then told me it was not in stock anymore. Very disappointed, Did not work last year for a Christmas present so I returned it. Bought it again this year, didn't work this year either, This is a great product but it just doesn't shoot far enough for my Border Collie. She will drop the balls in and watch it shoot but it doesn't launch high enough to catch. She prefers the Nerf gun., I’m very disappointed in this product. It barely tosses the ball no matter which setting, Border Collie Playtime, He loves it. I bought this for my boy three years ago, he will be four in October. Took him about 30 day to learn how to use it. We have it set up in the house in the winter so he can get exercise without getting wet and muddy. In the summer we move it outside under the overhang of the house so it doesn't get wet if it rains. This machine is pure heaven and no more throwing a nasty dirty ball. I used the blue tennis balls that came with the machine, they are garbage. They are hard and they shattered after about 10 mins of play. Pretty crappy that you blow through 3 brand new balls that come with your machine in less then 45 mins. Well I got over that fact fast, because]

title: Nerf Dog Air Strike Launcher Dog Toy, 25-in
descriptions:
['If you’re tired of picking up your dog’s tennis ball with your bare hands, then Nerf Dog’s Air Strike Launcher is the perfect solution! This easy-to-use dog toy allows you to easily cup and throw your pup’s tennis ball without getting all his slobber on you. Its lightweight and flexible design make it easy and comfortable for pet parents to use and it’s especially great for those who suffer from shoulder, back or knee issues. Every Air Strike Launcher comes with a squeaky Nerf Dog tennis ball, so you and your best bud can get to playing right away!', '

                        See all items by Nerf Dog
']
key_benefits: ['Helps keep your hands clean during a game of fetch with your sidekick.', 'Designed to allow pet parents to easily cup and throw the ball without bending down.', 'The lightweight, flexible and curved design is easy to use and comfortable for most pet parents.', 'A great option for pet parents with shoulder, back and knee injuries.', 'Every purchase comes with a squeaky tennis ball, so can use your Air Strike Launcher right away!']
reviews: [Fits all tennis balls, the ball that comes with the launcher lasted 2 throws. Best bet would be buy other balls. Launcher works great throws ball far and provides lots of exercise, My dog received this as a Christmas present. I love the product. Only negative I found so far is the ball was a dud. Didn't bounce at all. I use a regular tennis ball with it., While it lasted. We did one round of fetch. I left it In the back yard and 1 of three pups must have been too rough with it and broke the cup the ball fits in. I’ll definitely be ordering a new one when I can., I am giving this item a 5-star review because I bought this item for the thrower itself and not the ball. The thrower is awesome and being able to hold an extra ball is a huge bonus because sometimes we lose one and then all the fun is over! I do agree with all of the other comments that the ball is not the best. Our lasted maybe 6 trips to the park before it got a hole and didn't throw right so we have since tossed it. Thankfully we have tons of tennis balls to replace it with!, The Air Strike Launcher Dog really doesn't bring much to the table over your normal throwing arm. Take the money you'd spend on this toy and buy a couple more tennis balls or something unique like the Hartz Dura Play balls instead. They're super tough and (according to the package) taste like bacon. Our dog loves his. This toy has been relegated to gathering dust in our pantry., Works great for keeping up with our puppy lab who wants to fetch balls all day long., I bought this for two reasons. One, I watch dogs often and some are more energetic than others and my arm will get tired way before they do. And two, I like to play with my neighbor’s dog that loves balls. But he will drop his ball right at the base of our chain link fence on his side, and I can’t reach it to pick it back up. This works perfectly to reach over and scoop the ball up to throw it again!!, Great if you buy different tennis balls for it. The nerf one broke in literally one retrieve. My BC bit it right in half. Guess I'll order some chuckit balls instead for it! If it hadn't been on sale for so cheap, i would've just bought another chuckit launcher. Works the same and the tennis balls actually are useful, This is great for helping pick balls up off of the ground so you don't have to keep bending over. Not long enough to prevent you from having to bend at all, but it really helps! The ball that came with it is just okay, nothing special., My dad’s dog absolutely loves this!!! She loves fetch and will bring me this to play with her!! It’s also great because it’s hard to get the ball from her sometimes and this makes it easy!!]

descriptions:

key_benefits: ['High quality steel construction that is rust and chip resistant.', 'Allows to hands free ball pick up, making a game of fetch even easier.', 'Shoots up to 200 feet so you pup will get maximum run time.', 'Available in 4 ball & 1 ball designs.', 'Collapsible construction allows for easy storage and transport to and from the dog park or wherever you furry friend wants to go.']
reviews: [Our pup loves to play ball and our chuck it thrower worked wonderfully until our shoulders screamed in pain. We ordered the HyperPet launcher and using by hand it does not go any farther than a hand throw and it is difficult to pull back. I mounted it on a post and it worked wonderfully for two days and one band broke. I shortened the opposite band and got two more days and it broke. We have ordered three more bands but cannot afford to do this once a week! I do not recommend this product. Total waste of money!, This tennis ball slingshot is a pain to pull back. If they had manufactured it the way most slingshots are (with a counter brace over the top of the wrist to add stability while drawing the sling) they would have made a better product., Throw it by hand much farther. Get a chuck it hand thrower., Great concept and I was excited to try it out. It takes a lot of "pull" to get the ball to go anywhere worthwhile. Furthest I got it to go was about 50ft. Went back to my ChuckIt and its 100 - 150ft throws. Our dog is much happier again., Great launcher the dog really enjoys it,I would recommend these products to anyone having a dog., Great length it goes. Not 1 hand user friendly but great if you need to launch a good length away to make fetch simple and quick. Would be better if there was a finger tab to pull back and release, This is a well made product, yes. But....unless you are John Cena or a professional bow and arrow shooter, hang it up. You have to have wrists of steel to use this. Buy the sling shot that has the forearm support. My 27 year old son who works out had a hard time using this. Chewy had me donate it, which I gladly did., For a man, this would be a GREAT thing to use in playing with your dog. For a 59 year old woman, not so much. Not the products fault, I should have thought about it before ordering for myself to play with my dogs in the backyard., Its too stiff and hard to pull. My husband tried it and it doesn't work right, We bought once of these when they were commonly found in stores when our ShepX was a puppy. he LOVED this thing. Just seeing it, he would get very excited. We did have to buy a number of replacement bands. More so once storing it in a plastic cabinet on our covered porch, in the hot and cold more than when it was inside. We had bought replacement bands over Ebay, as at the time it was the only place to find them. The generic are cheaper, though that 2 pack lasted as long as one of the actual replacements made by hyperpet. It has a few rusty spots now due to being stored with damp balls on it. Buddy Boy crossed the bridge last summer, but we kept this as we figured he would want us to make some]

reviews: [I ordered the small launcher and my Corgi loves this. It took me less than 24 hours to train my dog. At first she was cautious of the sound, Now it’s her cue to get ready to fetch. My two complaints are that the balls are poorly made, coming apart rather quickly… We went through three balls in less than 10 days. I reordered 2.5” balls and realized that this machine does not take that size...it requires much smaller balls. the small launcher does not use the 2.5 inch ball as stated in the description/Q&A. The smaller balls are still $13- $15 for three balls that I know will be destroyed in less than 10 days and that is disheartening. Perhaps the price of the balls should be reduced if the balls, The balls that came with it didn't last long but it does work with 2.5 diameter balls. It just seems a little flimsy for the price but my Shepherd enjoys it., This ball launcher is the best; however, the balls are very poor quality, they easily break.]
