title: Outward Hound Zip Stick Launcher Dog Toy, Green, Large
descriptions:
['Get ready for a zippin’ good time with Outward Hound’s Zip Stick Launcher Dog Toy! This play-session essential can launch Outward Hound’s Woofie Ballz (included as well as sold separately) up to 100 feet in the air! It also features plastic ridges along the toy that create an enticing “zip” sound when the Woofie Ballz are released. The long, lightweight, curved launcher also makes it easy for you to pick the balls up without using your hands—that means no more slobbery fingers! Welcome to the future of fetch!', '

                        See all items by Outward Hound
']
key_benefits: ['Can send Outward Hound’s Woofie Ballz (included as well as sold separately) soaring up to 100 feet in the air!', 'Features plastic ridges that create a fun “zip” sound when the Woofie Ballz are released.', 'Can launch up to 3 Woofie Ballz at the same time, making it paw-fect for multi-dog households.', 'Allows for hands-free pick-up—gone are the days of slobbery fingers!', 'Lightweight and easy to hold for comfortable play sessions.']
reviews: [This toy is great. We have 2 Golden Retrievers and one of them has a strong drive for retrieving and the other one not so much. With this toy they can play together and both have fun at the same time. The zip sound seems to add motivation to play time. The balls are very durable. The price was great too, I have had so much fun using this with my 5 month old golden retriever puppy! He is, of course, a ball of energy. He has a hard time fetching larger, heavier balls just yet, and will often lose interest after a few throws because of that. These balls are the perfect solution since they're much lighter weight and have the openings to help him carry them back! Also love that the balls aren't fabric like tennis balls so they're easy to rinse off if they get muddy. The "zip" sound really keeps him excited and engaged, too. One of the best toys I've ever bought!, It doesn’t go as far as the chuck it we love, but the fun zip sound it makes is cool! Its actually perfect for my backyard since I tend to throw the chuck it too far and it goes over the fence sometimes. One reason I’m not giving it five stars is we have only been using it a few days and the ball is starting to wear. For the price, though, cant be beat!, My dog loves this toy. She loves the zip sound and she loves to chase the balls. It’s even better since multiple balls can be thrown each time. She enjoys the tennis ball launcher on occasion, but she is engaged with this toy almost every time I take it out. The balls are lightweight and easy for her to hold in her mouth and squish a bit, which she seems to enjoy. They have stood up to a Labrador Retriever’s chewing for a few weeks so far!, My pups don't always like the same toys, but they both love this one! My oldest is especially hard to please and this is now one of his favorites!, Ok, we currently have another launcher and must say for the price this is a great toy! Balls are hollow, the handle is light, easy to pick up and you can fling the balls super far., Although it doesn't launch as far, my dog is obsessed w this toy. These are the only types of balls that he fetches. The balls are light and open compared to other balls., My ball fetching grandpuppy could not be happier and neither could I. No more picking up and throwing slobbery balls. And this sucker flings these special balls pretty far which helps wear his puppy energy out. Love it!!, My 2 american pitbulls love this new fetch toy I got for them., Lame! Cost too much, there is no launching really. You just toss it off the stick]

title: Hyper Pet Ultimate Fetch Dog Toy Pack, 3-pack
descriptions:
["No matter where you and your pup play, play hard with the Ultimate Fetch dog toy pack from Hyper Pet. This dynamite variety pack comes with several toys designed for those long afternoons of tossing, fetching and catching! With the Hyper Fling launcher, you can throw further than ever—this handy launcher does the hard work for you and effortlessly flings the included tennis ball up to 100 feet away. And the ball? It's a multi-textured sphere made of grade-a rubber, so it's built fly, bounce, and endure buckets of slobber. If your fun takes you to the water, remember to bring the foam ball that's gentle enough for your hardwood floors and buoyant enough for water play. Your pup will love getting her paws wet to fetch, and you'll love bonding with your furry friend. And, if that's not enough, toss The Fun Square—soft on the inside, but built with a tough, nylon shell on the outside. You'll have everything you need to have a ball with your dog.", '(1) Hyper Fling Launcher, (2) Hyper Fling Pro Tennis Ball, (1) Hyper Fling Pro Chewz Ball, & (1) Hyper Fling Pro Fun Square', '

reviews: [Thanks to Chewy for refunding this item. The design of this thrower is unusual, it's probably some engineering marvel, but darned if I can say it's any better than a regular cheap plastic thrower. Be aware that HyperPet is designed with a hole in each device. Put the ball over the post, throw. Sometimes it comes off, sometimes it doesn't. I can throw with my old-lady arm better than use this device. You'll not be able to use old tennis balls, etc. with this device. My dog chewed the square within a day. I accidentally hit him couple times with the metal (?) Hyper Pet thrower. Save your money. Go back to the regular throwers. I'm not a fan of this engineering., Great for not wanting to get your hands dirty! My Dads shepard loves the foam like ball thingy! Big fan., This comes with a tennis type ball and a hard ball. I prefer the tennis ball.]

title: Nerf Dog Super Soaker Launching Frog Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Give your energetic pal a toy optimized for extra-high launching and fetching with the Nerf Dog Super Soaker Launching Frog Dog Toy. This frog-shaped toy provides hours of interactive play. Simply pull the frog head to launch it with the elastic slingshot - up to 25 yards! Then watch your pup chase after it for hours on end, providing enriching play and much-needed exercise. It’s built with special, high-performance materials like thermoplastic rubber. Because it also floats on water, it’s the perfect take-along toy for the beach, pool, lake, or your favorite water play spot.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', '

                        See all items by Nerf Dog
']
key_benefits: ['High-flying dog toy with slingshot can be launched up to 25 yards for fetching.', 'Built to stand up to extra tough play with thermoplastic rubber and polyester fill.', 'Provides plenty of enriching entertainment and hours of much-needed exercise.', 'Waterproof Super Soaker design floats on water to make it splash play ready.', 'Perfect for the backyard, beach, lake, or pool for hours of play.']
reviews: [This toy wasn’t even out of the wrapper 10 minutes and the stitching came out in 2 places. Don’t get me wrong, great concept and fun toy just cheap material. Our dog loved it but we couldn’t risk her ingesting the stuffing. If the product is ever made with more durable material, we would try it again., I opened the package, pulled back the launcher, and it snapped on first launch attempt. Never got to play with the toy. Will try other launch products. Dog loves fetch!!!, Unfortunately, froggy only lasted 3 days after delivery. Sampson is a 10 month old Old English Bulldog and took Froggy's head off.. so Froggy does not fly anymore..., This toy is fun for both you and your pet but if you have a chewer, I do not recommend. It took one day for him to rip the thumb slot off, shred along the lining and tear out the stuffing., I thought it was well made I just have a super chewer that tears everything up we called it Rocket Man. I'd pull head up 2x yell Rocket man & throw it. She torn head off 1st!, Cheap product! I shot it about 5 feet twice and on the third try the head came off, Our 4 month old puppy destroyed this toy in 15 mins. I wouldn’t recommend.]

title: Multipet Slinger and Ball Fetch Dog Toy, 18-in
descriptions:
['Get ready to "go long" once you unwrap the Slinger and Ball dog toy from Multipet. This innovative toy allows you to play fetch with your best pal without making a mess. The clever design helps you sling the included ball even further than your best one-handed pitch, then lets you pick it up hands-free—that means no more slobber all over your fingers! The Slinger's long neck and easy-grip handle make games of fetch more comfortable than ever while allowing you to launch that ball further than ever. With a ball made of super-strong rubber, it's a great set for dogs of all sizes and breeds. So, what are you waiting for? Play ball!', 'This item ships in a variety of fun and random colors!', '

                        See all items by Multipet
']
key_benefits: ['Allows you to play long rounds of fetch without the mess, thanks to the ergonomic launcher that picks up slobbery toys hands-free.', 'Launches your fetch ball further than ever, so your dog can really feel the wind in his fur as he runs to catch it.', 'Elongated neck and easy-grip handle makes holding and using the Slinger comfortable, so it fits comfortably in your hand.', 'Hands-free play makes it easier than ever to keep up with your rowdy pup.', 'Suitable for dogs of various sizes and breeds, with an included ball made of super-strong rubber.']
reviews: [The ball has to be picked up and placed on thrower. Short thrower requires a lot of bending down and not easy to place ball on thrower without picking it up., My golden retriever absolutely loves this toy! He loves playing fetch anyway but this brings it to a whole different level. We have to hide it when we get tired of playing otherwise he sits In front of it and cries. I think the way the ball bounces so much and the rubber texture make it extra appealing to him.]

key_benefits: ['Tennis ball launcher sends balls up to 65 feet for awesome canine play and exercise.', 'Portable design features a removable shoulder strap.', 'Great for play in the yard or park!', 'Comes with two tennis balls that store easily in the launcher.', 'Hands-free pickup keeps your hands clean and sanitary during play sessions.']
reviews: [Not to impressed it pulls way to hard and doesn’t project to far don’t use would like a refund thank you, Thought this could also use regular tennis balls but they do not fit. Also, it definitely does not launch the ball 60 feet like it claims. A Chuck-It goes way further. Disappointed, as I was really looking forward to this solving the problem of over throwing with my arm.]

Brightly colored with a clip ball form so he can track it with ease and you’ll never lose a part, this interactive toy gets you both back in the game.', '

reviews: [This launcher is perfect! It launches just far enough that it goes across my backyard, but not over the fence. As soon as I pick it up, my dog goes wild! She loves to fetch, and my shoulder loves this launcher. We purchased squeaky rubber Nerf dog balls to go with it. Pure joy for all who have tried it!, What a joke... launched ball about 15 feet.. unless you have a broken arm or work for nerf.. you don’t need this.. keep looking]

title: Spunky Pup Ball Blaster Ball Launcher Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Your canine companion will “have a ball” playing with Spunky Pup’s Ball Blaster Dog Toy. This launcher can send tennis balls flying up to 60+ feet in the air—now that’s an exciting game of fetch! This nifty gadget also allows for hands-free pickup—that means no more slobbery fingers or strained backs. The ergonomic pre-curved sleek design is easy and comfortable to hold and the toy is a cinch to use. Simply pump the air and then launch the ball into the sky to really get your hound going!', 'Spunky Pup Tennis Ball.', '

                        See all items by Spunky Pup
']
key_benefits: ['This lightweight launcher can send balls soaring up to 60 feet in the air!', 'Allows for convenient hands-free pickup so you don’t have to bend down and pick up your dog’s slobbery toy.', '100% powered by air—that means no hazardous springs or elastic bands.', 'The more air you pump into the toy, the further the ball will go!', 'Comes with one tennis ball, so you can get the fun started right away!']
reviews: [Shoots the ball about 3 feet, if that... I do not recommend, This thing doesn't even launch the ball 10 feet. Idk how in the world they got it to do that in the video. I got mad after shooting it twice and never picked it back up.. get a better brand don't waste your money!, Just received ours and must agree. Don't bother. Wish we'd seen jagfangrandma's review before we ordered it. She's right on. First time we fired it went about 3 feet - straight into the dog's mouth. Second try took nearly 30 pumps (first 5-10 don't even take)and the ball went all of 15 feet. Whoo. Going back to our trusty K-9 Kannon, This thing didn't throw the ball 10 feet and even that was an effort to get it to throw that far. Don't waste your money. 10 feet is nothing for our golden retriever he's at the ball site before the ball even gets there.]

title: Ruff Dawg Cat-A-Pult Launching Dog Toy, Color Varies
descriptions:
['Ruff Dawg Cat-A-Pult Launching Dog Toy is a vanilla-scented toy made of 100% superior grade rubber that is tear and puncture resistant. You’ll never have to worry about sharp edges, breaking or splinters. The catapult is designed to be stretched and launched through the air for hours and hours of fetching fun. And it floats in water, so you both can enjoy some fetching fun in the pool, lake or ocean too.', 'Ships in a variety of random and fun colors!', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', '

                        See all items by Ruff Dawg
']
key_benefits: ['A vanilla-scented toy made of 100% superior grade rubber that is tear and puncture resistant', 'Designed to be stretched and launched through the air for hours and hours of fetching fun', 'It floats in water, so you both can enjoy some fetching fun in the pool, lake or ocean too', 'Fill the Cat-a-Pult with treats and launch this safe toy for training and exercising your four-legged friends', 'Gentle on teeth and gums, perfect for puppies and older dogs!']
reviews: [My dog LOVES this toy but I really have to keep an eye on him with it because it's incredibly thin material. If he were left to his own devices with this toy, it wouldnt have lasted 5 minutes out of the box. Overall, it's fun but I wouldnt purchase again because he is a chewer and it's just not strong enough for that., The item I received was covered in dirt when it arrived which actually discolored the item permanently. Seems like maybe it was a return that someone tossed out in the yard and decided they didn’t like. I haven’t actually tried it yet because it’s not something I could just give to my pup to play with. She would destroy it in minutes. I shoulda returned it but had already ripped off the packaging before I realized it was discolored., I have one puppy; she is a chewer for sure. That's why I was excited when this said it was tear and puncture resistant. NOT! My puppy broke it into pieces within 8 minutes. Had to basically throw it all out so she wouldn't eat the plastic pieces. Extremely disappointed. It's so hard to find durable toys for her but at least don't claim to be if you aren't!, My 75lb lab likes this toy for fetch. We took it to the beach for her to retrieve and she brought it back but did not seem enthused.....it has a hole in the top of and back of head and I am fairly certain she took in a mouthful of salt water while retrieving it. So this is a no for the beach but would be great for a pool or lake!, Can't chew it up, can't break it. It tugs (if it is allowed in your house); you can shake it, throw it, toss it. But best of all when the dog tosses it into your TV screen, it softly bounces off with no damage done. I love this toy, have bought many of them so there is always one nearby.]

title: Chuckit! Classic Launcher Dog Toy, Color Varies, Original
descriptions:
["Go long. No, really long. Really really long! With the Chuckit! Classic Ball Launcher, you'll easily be able to throw three times as far as normal, and without ever bending over or touching a slobbery ball again. Grab the comfortable handle, press down on the ball, and let it fly. You'll wear Fido out in no time! Perfect for the dog park and wide open spaces. Not so great for studio apartments.", 'Ships in a variety of random and fun colors!', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off. Use only standard tennis balls or Chuckit! Brand balls manufactured for use with this product. High speed flying balls can cause injury to animals and people. Do not aim or throw directly at people or animals. Be alert, the ball may travel in unanticipated directions. Not for indoor use.', 'Pair this Classic Launcher with the Breathe Right Fetch Ball 2-Pack toy or the Breathe Right Fetch Ball toy.', '

                        See all items by Chuckit!
']
key_benefits: ['Includes one ball for hours of fun with your pup.', 'Exercise your buddy while saving your arm.', 'Hands- free pickup so you don’t have to touch anymore doggy slobber.', 'Features an ergonomic handle for ultimate comfort and control.', 'Made of durable lightweight flexible plastic that fits any medium 2.5 inch Chuckit! ball.']
reviews: [This ball launcher is longer than the previous Chuckit! that I have and I like it better because of that. It's a simple device and works like it's supposed to. It essentially extends the length of my throwing arm and makes it possible for me to really sling a tennis ball a long way, giving my Airedale a lot of fun exercise. Like other Chuckit! launchers, it also makes it easy for me to pick up a slimy, muddy ball without having to touch it! I've tried using one of the ball "guns", but this is much better (and cheaper)., My dogs LOVE this toy and the balls are the only indestructible balls I've found for strong chewers! I DO wish you'd mark the launchers Small-Med-Large to match the ball sizes. I ordered this one to replace one my GSD chewed up but our balls are all Large. I couldn't tell from the description that this one is Size Medium, so couldn't use it and ended up donating to our local shelter with new balls. Just make it easier to order by size, please. Otherwise, it's an awesome toy for dogs with "ball drive"!!, The ball is a bit hard for our puppy baby now, but as he grows I’m sure we will have much fun with it. The construction is well made with sturdy strong plastic so I think it will last and last. Like the bright neon colored ball and the blue tosser seems to be made strong. Sure will aid in a day’s fun. Can’t wait!, We have a very active Schnoodle that loves to run and loves to be chased. Our granddaughters throw the ball with this launcher so the dog runs fast and they try to outrun him. It wears them all out, which my husband and I greatly appreciate some days! It is well made and should last a long while. Even with the "abuse" it gets from the kids., After two months of use, I can safely say my Aussie shepherd pup loves this! She will chase repeatedly and with my bad shoulder, this makes it incredibly easy. I even learned to throw with my opposite arm. It includes one tennis ball, but I bought the 2pk of rubber balls which have good bounce and make it more fun. If not for the stifling heat we’d be playing right now. Though she’s giving me the eye right now., Gracie loves this toy. Allows me to throw the ball a LOT further than normal. Gracie did destroy the heavier orange ball that came with it, but it works fine with tennis balls or replacement balls. Recommended., This is the best product for playing fetch with our fury babies. I have back issues, so this is very handy picking up the tennis ball and throwing it. I would highly recommend getting one, you won't regret it!, We have a 2 year old German Shephard/supposedly Black Lab. mix, (heavier on the Shephard), who's favorite activity is "Playing Fetch" with her ball... Insistently. However, my bad shoulder and back, limited how much I could play with her. Then I saw "Chuckit". I bought the standard wand and ball. Knowing how quick the ball might get lost in our heavily wooded, semi-rural yard, I bought a set of additional balls, and a set of Glow in the Dark balls too, for nighttime fun. Good thing I did. What I didn't know when ordering, was the ball with the wand, is a tennis ball, our dog's bite destroys tennis balls with the first bite. Also what I didn't realize when ordering, the set of Tough Balls I bought, The worst tennis ball to date. It did not last one single play session. Good thing i have other balls that fit the launcher already. Very poor quality even for a tennis ball, I have a wimpy throwing arm, the chuck it! Helps me thrown AT LEAST 5 times farther than I could without it! Have purchased this multiple times, since my dogs think it’s a chew toy if I don’t secure it after play!]

title: Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Dog Toy
descriptions:
['With the Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Dog Toy, you’ll get way more throwing power than ever before. You can launch tennis balls up to 50 feet in the air without wearing out your arm way before your pup even breaks a sweat. This high-powered Tennis Ball Blaster has a safety release mechanism and is easy to operate, so the whole family can play. After your faithful friend returns with the ball, you won’t have to touch it to pick it up—just use the end of the launcher and you’re ready to go. The Tennis Ball Blaster works with any standard tennis balls or you can use the Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Replacement Tennis Balls.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'The Medium and Large Tennis Ball Blasters work with any standard tennis balls or you can use the Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Replacement Tennis Balls.', '

                        See all items by Nerf Dog
']
key_benefits: ['Propels balls up to 50 feet in the air for a fun way to play with your dog in the park or in your own backyard.', 'Comes with a safety release mechanism that’s easy to operate, plus it has no exposed moving parts. making it safe for the whole family.', 'No need to touch the ball to pick it up—simply use the end of the launcher and avoid a slobbery mess.', 'Uses Nerf Dog Tennis Ball Blaster Replacement Tennis Balls or any standard tennis balls in the Medium and Large Blasters.', 'Interactive toy provides excitement and a great workout for your dog while being safe and easy for you!']
reviews: [We love it more than our dog! I was very excited to get this toy for my ADD husband, who gets bored throwing the ball to the dog. He loved it and was testing it out in the house, lol! One of our dogs doesn't like the noise it makes, and is not a huge fan, but it's perfect for our hyper active pitt-mix! Our arms don't get tired, but he does chasing the ball all day. I do wish it came with an extra ball (if you lose that one that comes with it, smaller, standard tennis balls do fit, but not as well)., Australian Shepherd Approved. Nuff said? We've used this thing way more than a year, and more times a day than I would try to count. I've shot this blaster so many times a day for so many months I have tennis elbow so...watch out. Change up the hand with which you pull the trigger. I didn't. Didn't even realize I was going south til I woke up one day South!, I like Nerf products but not for dogs. Well, at least not for my pooch who has a serious bite. Balls lasted maybe 15 minutes before they were shredded. Also, launcher does not launch as advertised. Better off spending the money on a good sturdy ball and toss it around the old fashion way., My 6 year old couldn’t get the ball out so he tried to pull it out... his hand was super stuck. The screws don’t open it completely and my husband had to cut it apart. Why wouldn’t you be able to take it apart?! It was a wonderful way to be woken up this am., My dog Ramon is obsessed with this gun! His first one lasted about 7 months with using it easily 100 times a DAY! The only reason we bought a second was the rubber band snapped from over use! We’ve also gifted it to a few ball loving pups!, This is so much fun for the dogs. They LOVED it and now that it broke (only a few months after getting it) fetch just isn't the same. I haven't taken it apart to figure it out but it seems like the spring or band inside that launches the ball snapped in half., My dogs LOVE this toy! I just wish it would shoot the ball farther. Also the chunk it balls fit! Which is great if your dogs are hard on balls! Tennis balls rarely last more than a day., I bought this for my husband as something fun to try with our ball centric dogs. He used it for exactly 5 throws and the trigger stopped working. Chewy customer service was great. Full refund and best of all they didn’t make me send it back. I can throw it away., My 3yr old Shepherd mix loves this ball shooter!! Literally can’t contain his excitement even when you just pick it up. Great way to get them to learn fetch play. My only concern is that I have purchased 4 of them over 3 years because they broke from so much use. However for the price I will keep buying it because I have a very sad dog when it breaks and he waits for the new one to be delivered! Lol, This is the best toy ever! Our German Shepherd puppy, Panzer, is a 7 month old 70 lb fireball. He has always loved retrieving tennis balls so when I saw this blaster I had to get it. I read the reviews and some are negative regarding the noise and operation of the blaster. I only have positive things to say - it is not loud, it is so easy to use, and it is saving my arm from throwing the ball over and over. Panzer immediately figured out the trajectory of the ball and looks out into the yard expectantly - sometimes catching it in midair. My husband thinks I like the blaster more than Panzer (I do!). I HIGHLY recommend this blaster. We use it several times a day, it is easy to use, it ]

title: Chuckit! Junior Launcher Dog Toy, Color Varies
descriptions:
["Play area too small for the classic Launcher? Now there's one suitable for smaller parks and yards. The Chuckit! Junior Ball Launcher is perfect for pups who just don't like to run as far, or lose focus when they're too far away. With the 19-inch long Launcher, you can fling a ball twice as far as you can with your arm alone, without the slobbery mess.", 'Ships in a variety of random and fun colors!', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Pair this Junior Launcher with the Breathe Right Fetch Ball 2-Pack toy or the Breathe Right Fetch Ball toy.', '

                        See all items by Chuckit!
']
key_benefits: ['Comes with one Chuckit! ball', 'Exercise your dog for hours while saving your arm', 'No more hands full of dog slobber', 'Lightweight, durable design fits comfortably in your hand', 'Use with all medium Chuckit! balls']
reviews: [My dog's full sized Chuckit was lost on a trip. Since I have a fenced yard and the ball sometimes is launched over the fence, I decided to get the Junior which does not launch as far. The lip directs the ball the ground . . .about 6 feet in front of me! Very disappointing. I ended up buying a full sized one to replace it. I do not recommend the Junior for anyone. Anyone can bounce the ball 6 feet away with their hand!, This makes playing "fetch" easier on owners, but the desription is confusing. There's no reason for this to be designated as "toy" or "junior", unless the owner/thrower is very short. The purpose of using it is to prevent having to bend to pick up a ball, but the "toy" or "junior" size is too short! The bigger the "dog" the longer the handle, so if you want the longer handle, order as if for a larger dog., We have (2) Chuckits, (1) 18" long, (1) 26". This one is so short, there is no throwing power: the ball simply bounces down in front of you but behind (not beyond) even the smallest canine. Do not purchase this size, (could not find length in product description but that may be my oversight) - it will be a waste of your $ and a big disappointment if you've not used the product in the past., I have two 10 month old pups and they both really enjoy running after tennis balls, this chuckit is a great way to give them maximum exercise., Should have gotten one of these years ago!! I have owned dogs my whole life! It is amazing how this device saves the arm and shoulder! Makes throwing balls so much easier for me and my dogs!, I can fling the ball about twice as far with this launcher which gives my dog a lot of exercise. The best part is when he brings it back and drops in on the ground I can pick the ball up with the launcher and not touch the spit covered ball with my hands. So I can sit out on the back porch and relax while giving my dog a great work out., The plastic molded product has changed, it has sharp edges, the plastic is weaker, the style of the launcher has changed and after trying it for a couple of days I decided to throw it out. I suggest going to the pet store and view one and see if it's like the old version. I'm sorry they changed their product. Not Chewy's fault., Disappointed. The ball holder part cracked within a half hour of light play, wasn’t aggressive or hard throwing and did t hit the ground and the ball holder cracked. ., I love this toy and so does my doggie. We had a chuck it in the past and would lose track of time when we'd take a trip to the park. This size works much better thou in our backyard. Helps shave off some extra energy and gets her nice and calm for the night. Would def recommend this toy to any pet parent! Get an extra set of balls. Especially if your dog is known to chew thru toys in a heartbeat, lol., the word Junior in this item made me think that it was going to be a smaller ball then the average tennis ball and it was not.]

title: Frisco Ball Launcher
descriptions:
['Take playtime outside with the Frisco Ball Launcher. Now you can toss that ball further with less effort so your pup can get his fill of fetch! The long, curved, flexible handle lets you throw the ball at a greater distance to give energetic dogs the added exercise they need, while saving your arm. The ergonomic handle makes it comfy to use so you can keep up with your fetch-loving friend game after game. The ball is included so you can get to fetching without waiting. Plus, no more slobber hands—the hands-free ball pickup action lets you dodge the drool.', '
                No toy is indestructible. Supervise your pet when using since small parts can present a choking hazard or internal blockage. Discontinue use if the toy is damaged. Keep out of reach of children 
', '

                        See all items by Frisco
']
key_benefits: ['Ball launcher and ball set provides hours of fun playing fetch with your pooch.', 'Long, curved, flexible handle lets you toss the ball further while saving your arm, so you can keep up with your pup.', 'Ergonomic handle helps prevent hand fatigue for longer play sessions.', 'No more picking up drool-drenched balls with hands-free pickup.', 'Perfect for energetic dogs that need extra exercise outdoors.']
reviews: [Whom ever came up with this idea is a genius. I don't have to touch the ball, my hands dont get dirty from the dirt in the park nor my dogs saliva. Also i doingt strain my back having to keep bending down and picking up the ball., We go through tennis balls playing daily, this launcher was ordered to save my back. It cannot accommodate a normal size tennis ball, it will fit into the launcher but doesn’t come out. I have tried two days, I will once more before I toss it. Hopefully someone reads this review and doesn’t purchase because I didn’t read any!, Works as advertised. Great for my son who is in a wheelchair. He does not have to bend over to get the ball to be able to play fetch with the dogs, Normal tennis balls are slightly too large forcing you to keep buying the balls that came with this I guess., This little thrower allows you to launch a tennis balls onto the next block. Great price, lots of fun., My GSD and I had a great run with the chuck it launcher for years and I ordered this thinking I’d save a couple bucks. It’s not worth it! My pup can play fetch for hours so quality is important. The plastic end makes it hard to keep from sliding (no rubber grip) and its kind of uncomfortable if you need to really throw it far. Spend the extra $ to get the chuck it brand!, My 1 1/2 year old lab has endless energy. This toy helps zap it, Helps me be able to play with him and not injure my shoulder, I didn’t realize how much I’d appreciate this ball launcher. By just applying a little pressure the head picks up any standard size tennis ball. And a flick of the wrist sends it far enough for a good fetch. Definitely saving me from some back and shoulder pain. #ChewyTeamRated, This has made playing fetch with Remi easier and more fun for her. I can throw the ball farther out and she actually brings it back to me to throw again! I think she approves of it too!]

key_benefits: ['Great way to exercise your dog without straining your arm or exhausting yourself.', 'Allows you to throw 2 to 3 times further, allowing your dog to fetch far and burn off energy.', 'Hands-free pickup means no more touching slobbery balls and getting your hands dirty.', 'Made from a durable and lightweight flexible plastic with an ergonomic handle for comfort and control.', 'Made in the USA and comes with one Chuckit! Ball. Also works with compatible tennis balls.']
reviews: [The original "Chuckit" was great. I just broke the second one I purchased, still have the first one. I need to purchase a new one. Unfortunate,. it appears it is not available in the LARGE 3 inch ball size. So now I am forced to shop elsewhere. I also have noticed that my regular dog foods are "not available at this time".. which has been that way for almost a year now. So.... I guess I will have to shop elsewhere. Sad because this was a great service. Goodbye Chewy., The medium Chuckit is a great size for my 60lb dog. The handle is sturdy, but the ball cracked in half after our first playtime! He’s not a stronger than normal chewer, and plays with regular tennis balls every day. Was a little disappointed., We got this to keep at our home for our “grand dog” when she comes to visit. She’s a border collie and loves to run and chase the ball. Great launching action and goes really far...she loves it., The thrower is fantastic! However, the ball that came with it??? Broke in less than a week. Sooo now I have to head to the store to purchase replacement balls so my Emma can continue to have fun, don't love the tennis ball, but the launcher is awesome!! Lasts for years if taken care of and works great with the other options they have!, I love how this item can sure save on your arm for throwing the ball, the problem is my Boxer had it for maybe 3 hrs & already chewed a hole in the ball. Well of course he loves the ball so wont let it go obviously it wont launch as far with a hole in it ha,ha. It will work with regular tennis balls so that is what I am using, I dont buy the dog tennis balls cuz they never last. The real ones last alot longer with my strong jawed little guy., I always appreciate all the staffs. They go extra mill to serve the customer. I am customer and be back. Thank you Chewy, Although my dog doesn’t fetch he will chase after the ball. It’s good exercise., I purchase my third Chuckit. My dog tore up the ball first time I used it. Good thing I had the ball from the one I bought last year. This last one is junk. Don’t waste your money., I had a chuckit - lasted for a long time, finally cracked, bought another one called sport launcher. It is not the same as the first one and I hate it. I can't control the direction of the ball!]

title: iFetch Tennis Balls
descriptions:
['Get backup for the iFetch Automatic Ball Launcher with the iFetch Tennis Balls. With standard and mini-sized options for both the iFetch too and iFetch mini, these replacement balls ensure the fun never has to end. They are felted just like regular tennis balls, but the special design is made for dogs with a non-abrasive material that goes easier on their teeth. Just drop one in the automatic launcher, and let the fun begin! Chances are your dog might lose track of one or two, so these replacement packs are an easy way to ensure the fetch never stops.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Compatible with iFetch Mini Automatic Ball Launcher Dog Toy and iFetch Mini Frenzy Dog Toy', '

                        See all items by iFetch
']
key_benefits: ['Replacement balls for the iFetch Mini and iFetch Too automatic ball launchers.', 'Mini balls come in a 5-pack and work with the iFetch Mini with a 1.6-inch diameter.', 'Standard balls come in a 3-pack and work with the iFetch Too with a 2.5-inch diameter.', 'Felted like regular tennis balls, but with a non-abrasive material that’s easier on dog’s teeth.', 'The perfect way to ensure the independent fetch game never has to stop!']
reviews: [Brand new, doesn't work. Had difficulty reaching a live human for customer service. Sent an email and got an automated reply. I don't want my money back per se, I just want one that works. Chewy.com however, got the item to me quickly as usual. LOVE Chewy!, These balls are just the right size for the iKETCH that does not throw the balls out. The balls are dropped into the middle and come out several different sides. Dogs have to run to catch them. My dog loves them!, Destroyed within an hour. The dog loves them but they break easily and get stuck in the launcher., These balls are the perfect size for my Pomeranian and Chihuahua. They work great in the iFetch toy., My dog loves his ifetch, but he broke all these balls in a week. They are no different than any other tennis balls. I would be very interested if they came out with a stronger ball. I'm willing to put money on that., my dog is obsessed with chasing these balls that come out of the automatic ball thrower. i use it when i need to wear her out (which is often!). she loves these. they do tend to get covered with saliva so i replenish them often., My Westies love these, in or out of the ball machine they go to these balls first! I don’t leave these in the toy box, they have almost choked a time or two because they are so small, must be observed. Small for small dogs only. The small ones are smaller than a golf ball in size., I've been waiting for these. The balls can be used in the I fetch shooter or seperate. Little ones favorite indoor activity., where wrong size for ball thrower I have ...too small, Great size, terrible construction- our 20 pound Cavapoo loves them and demolishes them in an hour- so they will not be reordered.]

title: Chuckit! Pro Launcher Dog Toy, Color Varies
descriptions:
["Go long. No, really long. Really really long! With the Chuckit! Pro Launcher, you'll easily be able to throw three times as far as normal, and without ever bending over or touching a slobbery ball again. Grab the comfortable handle, press down on the ball, and let it fly. You'll wear Fido out in no time! Perfect for the dog park and wide open spaces. Not so great for studio apartments.", 'Ships in a variety of random and fun colors!', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Pair this Pro Launcher with the Breathe Right Fetch Ball 2-Pack toy or the Breathe Right Fetch Ball toy.', '

                        See all items by Chuckit!
']
key_benefits: ['Includes one ball for hours of fun with your pup', 'Exercise your buddy while saving your arm', 'Hands- free pickup so you don’t have to touch anymore doggy slobber', 'Features an ergonomic handle for ultimate comfort and control', 'Made of durable lightweight flexible plastic']
reviews: [The chuck it is great. Fits the need for a large dog. I chucked the ball a maybe 10 times- and it split down the middle. Design and QC issue probably. We continued to play with it for a day and make the most of it...it's ruined. Looking for a 3.5 LED nylon ball to chuck. Something solid with option to replace battery when it dies., First time I used the chucker it was difficult to get the right throw. Something changed from they way they were made originally. Just can't get the right distance and I have used these length chuckers 100's of times. The balls were different in that they were hard inside with a felt outside. First time I ever saw that and after (1) use the ball cracked in half and I have a lab who DOES NOT chew the balls like some dogs do. This was a first! Very disappointing., This Chuckit is shorter than my other one - which is what i was looking for. It works okay compared to the other one- but its cup is angled in a way that overhand throwing puts the ball short, directly into the ground. To get a longer toss you have to throw low, from the side., The reviews about the ball this comes with are correct, it was destroyed the first day. But the thrower itself is awesome! Our doodle loves to run FAR and brings the ball back every time. This thrower saves my husband’s shoulder and even I can throw the ball far with it. We upgraded to the whistler ball and he loves it! He chews on it before dropping it for the next run and it’s held up to it just fine, we’ve had it 3 months., I have multiple Chuckit ball tossers. This one is bad!! There is too much of a curve on the arm & tosses the ball to the ground near you. We also had to file down the top curve because it kept the ball too tight., My dog loves to fetch and whenever he sees us pick this up, he gets so excited. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because the tennis ball that comes with the launcher did not last long. I would recommend ordering the rubber chuck it balls at the same time you order the chuck it launcher., My girl loves to run and this is a great idea, but the ball that comes with it it terrible. It fell about after a few throws. I also bought the harder rubber ball. That has a great bounce. Unfortunately, it has such a great bounce that it bounced into the neighbors bushes and we have yet to find it., The Pro launcher does help throw balls farther, but it's too much. I have to launch as far as I can with the regular launcher for my dog, so I was hoping that the pro launcher would make it easier on my arm, but this launcher goes way too far. It's very durable and flexible and the handle is more comfortable than the regular launcher. It's way too long and a pain to carry around, even just from the car to the park. Also, it comes with a regular tennis ball, which is pretty much useless to our dog (it's destroyed in one day). You'd assume that a Pro launcher would come with something more durable, and Chewy mistakenly says that this comes with an Ultra ball in the product Q&A, disappointing, Perfect gadget for those with less than athletic throwing abilities. My dogs love it! I don’t get slobber all over my hands! I also purchased the glow in the dark balls for the chuck it to play at night., Well. To start with...I have a power chewer Doodle who absolutely loves the Chuckit Regular and amazingly doesn't destroy these smaller durable balls immediately. With the Pro Launcher, which I mistakenly thought would throw farther and be even more durable, had the large oversized tennis nall destroyed after our first outing. Now have a launcher, no longer or more useful than the Regular Model, unable to accept the durable smaller Chuckit balls. I wouldn't bother with another set of large tennis balls-useless. An oversize launcher without durable launchees (unless I gather large rocks to toss). Stick with the Regular Model!]

title: iFetch Mini Automatic Ball Launcher Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Give your arm a break with the iFetch Mini Automatic Ball Launcher Dog Toy. Designed especially for small to medium dogs, this interactive dog toy launches the ball for you! It’s perfect for when you’re away or busy doing other things—like getting his dinner ready—while ensuring he gets all the mental and physical exercise that he needs. All you have to do is plug it in, choose your launching distance and then drop in a mini ball. Soon your dog will learn how to drop it himself, which stimulates his mind and allows for totally independent play.', '(3) pack of iFetch Mini Tennis Balls, AC Adapter for 110 and 220 volts (batteries not included).', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Get an extra set of iFetch Mini Tennis Balls Here', '

                        See all items by iFetch
']
key_benefits: ['Automatic ball launcher is designed specifically for small to medium sized dogs.', 'Comes with three mini tennis balls that are 1.6-inches in diameter. Easier for small mouths to fetch!', 'Launches the ball 10, 20 or 30 feet, which can easily be changed with the push of a button.', 'Operates almost silently with a streamlined plastic design with rubber feet keep it in place.', 'Measures 10.5" x 7" x 7.5" high, with a 6.5" diameter ball return cone at the top and a 1-5/8" diameter ball launching hole.']
reviews: [We got this for our chihuahua terrier mix that loves fetch. He was so excited he peed on it when our other dog went near it! We used it in our hallway when we had a smaller house and no backyard on the low setting and it did great. We now use it in our large backyard and it works just as well. Only problem is some of the balls get frayed from use and then the launcher gets stuck or the balls won't launch. I use a sweater shaver thing to cut the extra stuff off but sometimes it still gets stuck. Still the best thing ever., VERY unhappy with my purchase. No fault to Chewy, but the iFetch did not work, spoke to customer service at iFetch who gave me an incorrect email address. Have since sent request to the proper address and gotten NO reply beyond an automated acknowledgment. I WANT A WORKING iFETCH!, I got this for my little dog Walter. He loves it. I haven't trained him to put the ball in the hole yet, but we are working on it. He is so at the ready, staring at the hole that the ball will come out of and when it does, he is off. Great for exercise for him and so fun to watch him., My dogs love this and get so excited to use it. But the motor dies really fast. I'm on my 2nd (the last was a gift as I wouldn't have gotten another). True to timing with the first, after about 9 mos of using it ~3 times a week for an hour, the motor just dies. This is a really, really expensive toy to die so quickly., This is fun toy no doubt. The down fall and at $65+ for the actual dispenser, I haven't been able to find balls that are compatible for the smaller unit. The replacement balls are $11-$12 for a sleeve of 4 mini balls. That's way out of line for tennis balls. I found that my Boston Terrier is biting down on the balls and cracking them., We have 2 Cavaliers both about 18 months they love the Ifetch so much!, This is an awesome toy, however the popping sound startles my dog so he will not get close enough to drop the balls back in. It is probably best for a large dog. There was a different style available that I think would probably be much better for small dogs. He does love chasing the balls so I will definitely continue to encourage him to use it by himself., This dog has a lot of energy and loves playing with toys., I was checking on this automatic ball launcher dog toy, and on the original website from the manufacturer if the enclosed balls are not working; use a squash ball the same size, and it works much better. The manufacturer said that any ball the same size would work. I want to purchase one for my little dog, and am leary because of the reviews for the ball not being able to launch and getting stuck, but was wondering if anyone has tried the squash ball?, The device is very well built and the concept is great. However, the balls become fuzzy within the first minutes of use and within a few dozen throws, the balls stick and won’t go through the machine. The ball fuzz will eventually become wrapped around the mechanism causing it to cease functionality. I’ve purchased both the iFetch and iDig. Both were unable to be used within 30-45 days. It really feels like a company that manufactures products and sell them without running it through any real-world testing.]

title: Hyper Pet Flying Series Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Hyper Pet Flying Series Dog Toy is an innovative sling shot style dog toy. Choose the goose, duck, pig, or mini duck and watch them fly. They even float!', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. key_benefits: ['Thumb released slingshot toy launches it up to 100 feet!', "Made with durable ballistic material so it's perfect for bringing to the dog park or in your backyard.", "These toys meet or exceed child toy safety standards, so you know they're safe for your loved one.", "Floats in water so it's great for bringing to the beach, lake, or pool.", "Available in several fun animal designs, colors, and sizes so you can pick the one that's best for your pet."]
reviews: [Although my puppy loved it, it wasn’t durable enough for him. He’s still in an aggressive teething phase so it’s hard to find toys that he won’t destroy. Although the body and the tail held up well, he had the cloth pulled out of its face overnight. It was a nice toy though. I wish he hadn’t destroyed it., Finley ,my full size rough collie, loves this duck. He is 3yrs old. I gave 4 stars because the sewing is not strong, he tore a wing off the day we got it, I was playing tug with him. So had to sew the side seem close. He does love to have it fly to fetch., I purchased this for my 3 year old husky. He loves to play with it and fetch it, however, it only lasted a few days. Tail came out and side ripped open. I'm going to try to patch it for the puppy to get more playtime out of it., This toy lasted two hours with my dog. They are not overly aggressive with any toy but the stitching quickly came apart on the body and the stuffing was out in no time. I would not recommend this toy at all., This toy lasted 13mins at the mercy of my 50lbs Indian Pariah Dog. It has so many small pieces it could easily have caused some problems. Tubes, small plastic bits inside—not great., This toy was broken within the first ten minutes of playing with it, my pit was not a fan of the toy, I was not happy with the durability., My dogs both love fetch, and the sling shot feature of the toy is cool. But this toy lasted less than five minutes with a 30 lb puppy playing with it. One tug and the wing fell off, exposing all of the stuffing. Kept playing with it because, well... i paid for it so i'm at least going to get one days use out of it; the beak fell off after another ten minutes of using it for its intended purpose. Don't waste your money., The seams all broke apart within a week of having it and our lab was only 12lbs and played only occasionally with it, This is a record for a toy being destroyed the fastest. My 50 lb dog was able to tug hard enough to pull the black rope out within 5 seconds of first playing with the toy out of the package. My dog loves this toy but it just doesn't last like it should., M puppy had this chewed apart within 2 hours, the wings are every thin material and the body also]

title: Nerf Dog Force Grip Trackshot Launching Duck Dog Toy
descriptions:
["Keep your furry friend entertained for hours with the Nerf Dog Force Grip Trackshot Launching Duck Dog Toy. The super-strong toy is Nerf Dog's specialty line of durable plush toys that stand up to your dog's teeth, thanks to the sturdy woven nylon exterior with tear-resistant polyurethane rubber coating. The medium Trackshot Duck Launcher will entertain you and your dog for hours on end, without hurting your shoulder. The elastic slingshot sends the attached plush toy hurtling through the air up to 75 feet, providing great exercise for your furry best friend. It's fun that will last, too—the trackshot arrowhead has special tear-resistant coating and stitching that's three times stronger than standard plush.", 'Created especially for paw-some games of fetch and catch, this toy is not designed to be a chew toy. Not recommended for aggressive chewers. Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', '

                        See all items by Nerf Dog
']
key_benefits: ['Durable plush toy made of a sturdy woven nylon exterior with tear-resistant polyurethane rubber coating for a long-lasting toy.', 'This launching duck toy will keep you and your dog entertained for hours while you play outside.', 'Promotes exercise and helps eliminate boredom—elastic slingshot catapults the attached plush toy through the air up to 75 feet.', 'Made with a special tear-resistant coating and stitching, which makes this thrilling toy three times stronger than standard plush.', 'The 12-inch duck is made for all breed sizes and all life stages with durable, lightweight material engineered for fetching, so it can stand up to your rough-and-tumble tosses.']
reviews: [We have a medium sized Australian lab Mix. I've known a Nerf toys to be a pretty good toy for humans. But for dogs? You guys are going to have to step up your efforts. My dog Boodee was able to rip through this launch duck and rip apart all the stuffing and spread it all over the house in two days. I think you should test your toys a little better at least if they're for a dog and if you really want to test them send them to me just send me free samples and I'll let you know how long they last with my dog I don't know how to tell you to make him tougher that's your job but I'd be more than happy to have my dog test them out for you just because I think nurses a good name and it's good for kids, Of all the toys I bought for my Australian Labradoodle puppy, this one is the best. It's her favorite as well...loves to retrieve and shake it hard. It's holding up well under her sharp teeth. I'm not sure it can fly as far as they say, but it does go all the way across our living area and nothing gets damaged in the process. It would probably fly further out doors with the wind at its back. The first time I tried to make it fly, it went about 5 feet (lol), but with practice I'm getting perfect., We use this in the pool as a fetch toy. It holds up to Abby and stays afloat!, Completely destroyed in 2 hours by my Australian Shepherd. Not for a chewer., This toy looks amazing at first then I started to use it and first of all the toy said it will launch 75 feet on the box, but that it not true at all maybe 10 feet on a good day. Also the knot at the end of the duck came totally unwound after the 3 pulls., Purchased for 14 week old Aussie doodle puppy. NOT super durable. A few hours of play last night on Christmas and it’s toast! Chewed holes in it and stuffing coming out. Less than a half day of use. Tempted to send this crud back. DONT buy!, My Cacapoo loves this toy . I fling it into the bushes like a real bird and he goes crazy, This toy is well made and launches well with not too much effort which is important cause I’m not good at pitching. However, my lab is just not interested in it, he prefers a nice round ball which he will chase forever., Unfortunately this ended up in the garbage after 10 minutes of play time due to poor stitching of the launching part after a few pulls the stitches started to pull out causing it to tear more and more each time. A real disappointment especially since she really liked it., Just bought this toy for my 45 lb German Sheperd mix. It lasted less than 15 minutes. I love the Nerf dog toys, we have a ton of them . So for this to say its extra durable and for it to be destroyed so quickly I was very dissatisfied and disappointed ;(]

title: Hyper Pet K9 Kannon K2 Tennis Ball Launcher Interactive Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Take aim and catapult your flinging fun to a whole new level with the Hyper Pet K9 Kannon K2 Tennis Ball Launcher Interactive Dog Toy. This innovative ball launching toy features hands-free ball pick-up, so you don’t have to get your hands slimy before effortlessly hurling the ball 75 feet across the field for hours of fetching fun and great exercise for your high-energy pal. It even comes with one of Hyper Pet’s own specially-designed balls that’s been engineered with your precious pup’s safety in mind. The ball is made of Grade A rubber so it’s paw-sitively safe on his teeth and doesn’t contain any harmful coatings or gases.', '(1) regular Hyper Pet ball.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Replacement Regular Hyper Pet Balls are available in Green, Orange and Pink.', 'Also available as a mini-size K9 Kannon K2 Toy for small breed dogs.', '

                        See all items by Hyper Pet
']
key_benefits: ['Launches tennis balls for spirited games of fetch with your pup.', 'Easy to operate with quick-trigger, seamless launching that really keeps your dog moving.', 'Adjust the distance using the handy lever to suit the size of your play area and your dog’s fitness level.', 'Lets you pick up the balls hands-free for all of the fun with none of the slobber.', 'Comes with one K-9 Kannon and one Hyper tennis ball to shoot for loads of fetching fun!']
reviews: [Keeping my Golden happy is second to keeping her healthy! Awesome ball launcher does both! Just the sight of this gun creates wagging tails and tapping paws. Shoots the balls farther than I can throw them and this is my replacement from another brand. The last one lasted over 2 years, this one is built more sturdy and gets used daily. Our Golden is not hyper crazy, but will chase balls as long as you shoot them. Creates great exercise in a fun way!, This is my 4 yr old golden's favorite toy. He's been playing with them for most of his life and insists that we go in the yard to shoot about 5 times a day. I sit, he drops the tennis ball in my lap and he's ready to rock! 10 minutes is usually enough to wear him out...that is until the next time. This is great for weight control and muscle development! Of course it has to be replaced from time to time so we always keep a backup gun in the garage. PLEASE DON'T EVER DISCONTINUE THIS TOY!!!, I'm purchasing a new one today as finally wore the other one out. If you want to truly get distance, I recommend buying good pressurized tennis balls. They shoot farter and also bounce better. My dog loves to look over her shoulder when running to get it on the fly or at least on the first bounce. Fun to watch her leap for it., My boyfriend got this for our dog for Christmas and it just broke last week. We use it constantly!! My dog loves playing fetch but always gets the ball all slobbery so this no-touch cannon is AWESOME! We just got a new one in the mail. My dog recognized it as soon as I pulled it out of the box!!!, This is my third different tennis ball launcher and so far, the best! The other two brands broke within 2 months. It is made very well, easy for me with arthritis to pull the handle back. It shoots a standard tennis ball farther than the other launchers I’ve had. My lab heads right for the K9 Kannon launcher every time I let her outside. It is her ultimate favorite toy!, My dog is a runner and loves to play fetch. I bought this product based on the description saying it could launch a ball up to 75 ft. I haven’t been able to reach 20ft, if I’ve reached that. Very disappointed with this purchase., Just got this ball launcher today, ( 7/8/2020 ) Tried it out and It only launches the ball around 10 feet. Also came with only 1 ball. Tried to look up my order and I’m guessing that Chewy doesn’t carry this ball launcher anymore. And I just ordered this on July 2, 2020., Beaux Bella, our Black Lab, is really lackadaisical if a ball is simply thrown, especially by Mom who throws like girl. When she hears the ratcheting sound of an impending launch from the K9 Kannon she gets sooooooo happy her behind nearly wags off. However, we do need to keep it out of sight, to the point of using different hiding places to confuse her or she will either get so excited we have to get it & play, or if it's within her reach she will bring it to us The only downside to the K9 Kannon is not being able to replace the large rubber band. It lasts quite awhile, but eventually it does need to be replaced and your only recourse is to replace the toy., We love the K9 Kannon! We have a 2 year old German Shepherd and when it's not raining we play fetch 3-4 times a day. I can sit on our swing and shoot the Kannon as long as he wants to chase it. I have tried several other devices and this has been the best by far. Only issue is the rubber band inside is not available to purchase. As often as we play, sometimes it wares out about 6 months. It usually still works but doesn't shoot nearly as far. Keep indoors when not in use as extreme heat or cold will shorten its life. New/dry balls also shoot farther. I keep 3 balls loaded in the gun just for fetch., This is the second one we have purchased. We used to have to stop throwing the ball because our arms hurt. No more. Now we can go until the dogs are tired, and, we do not have to touch the ball. Recommend highly. Just wish we could purchase the rubber bands separately.]

title: OxGord BazooK-9 Dog Ball Launcher Toy
descriptions:
['Playing fetch is a great way to exercise your pup, and the OxGord BazooK-9 Dog Ball Launcher Toy makes it super fun. Forget about simply throwing around the old tennis ball. Now you can launch it even further as it shoots out of the cannon for your pup to retrieve. This upgraded fetch toy includes two squeaky balls and has room to store two more standard tennis balls. It’s lightweight and you can even adjust the distance the ball will travel.', 'Pet Toy Ball Launcher Bazook-9 Cannon Gun, (2) Squeaky Balls, , Shoulder Strap.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff.
