It'll be a favorite of you and your pup in no time!"]
reviews: [Get my stuff @ Chewy. Came back looking for hyper pet's K9 Kannon. Chewy only had this one. Harsh recoil from a metal spring instead of silicone band and balls do not have the same velocity as Hyperpet., So, I bought this before I saw the bad reviews. I figured oh well whats the harm i already paid. Just a disclaimer too, we have two of the nerf brand ball shooters as well. For anyone looking for a ball shooter, I recommend the nerf gun brand in blue and orange. Those I got on sale a few yrs ago and it's truly worth it. I decided on a new one because we left our nerf ones outside in the rain amd sun and it doesnt shoot as smoothly now, but still way better than this product. I'm angry at this ball shooter, but the plastic is cheap, you can tell when you open it. The handle you pull back is cheaply made, I dont expect it to last long. The ball shoots fine for a backyard and my dog, Purchased this item to launch tennis balls for my Labrador, further then what this 63 old could throw them. This item doesn't send the balls are far as I either hoped or anticipated it would. On the plus it does save my arm when using it. Will continue shopping at Chewy because I have had good experiences before., Doesn't shoot more than maybe 40 ft. My dog looks at me as if to say seriously. Buy a chuck it cause this is useless., This launcher does not launch the ball far at all. It only went about 15 feet. Would not recommend for a big dog., My dogs LOVED this toy but I recieved it less than a month ago and the black pull back trigger has broken on this toy. I noticed it says 1 year warranty on the website. Wanting to get the toy replaced., This item was not what I read about before I purchased, did not live up to expectations. It doesn’t launch the ball very far, I can throw further!, The very first day the trigger broke, I should have read the reviews. Amazon was great about the return with immediate attention. They told me to keep, donate or throw away. I opened it, with 20+ screws holding the gun together you'd think it would be better quality, basically the black plastic parts are very brittle plastic and breaks quickly & easily. I'm trying to fix the very small parts with krazy glue., This blaster started out great! My Doxie loved it. It just gave out so easily. After like 50 launches it broke. :(, It worked but my dog was afraid of it because when you short it it makes a loud noise which disturbs my dog and now he is afraid of it I’m back to throwing as usual this just sites in the garage collecting dust]

title: Chuckit! Ultra Ring Launcher Fetch Dog Toy
descriptions:
["Help your dog spend his boundless reserves of energy with the Chuckit! Ultra Ring Launcher Fetch Dog Toy. This interactive chase and fetch toy will provide hours of playtime for you and your furry friend. Featuring a long, ergonomic handle with easy pick-up head, the toy allows you to keep playing fetch with your pal for longer. The unique topspin-infused action causes the toy to erratically bounce, zig-zag and hop on the ground like real game, engaging your dog's natural chase instincts. The ring launcher brings a new way to fetch, creating more fun, interactive way to spend time with your best friend.", 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'The fun never ends when you have the available replacement rings by ChuckIt!', '

                        See all items by Chuckit!
']
key_benefits: ['Interactive chase and fetch toy made from rubber, so it’s safe for doggie’s mouth.', "Flying dog toy acts like an animal, bouncing, zig-zagging and hopping, waking up your dog's natural chase instincts.", 'Withstands hours of fun whether it be out in an open field or at the beach and it’s a slobber-free pick-up toy.', 'Easy throwing motion—just flick it and let your furry best friend try and catch it.', 'The ring launcher fetch toy has long, ergonomic handle with easy pick-up head, so you won’t mind playing for as long as he wants.']
reviews: [I bought it to kind of mix it up throwing things, I somehow managed to peg myself with the ring while trying to throw it. It released “late” .... once I got the hang of it, the dogs weren’t that impressed with it compared to the ball. Also like some other reviews, my one dog fetched it and had it chewed by the time I got to her to get it. So it’s okay, maybe wouldn’t buy again., Cerreta and I love this toy. The ring fling is a little more fun than the ball Chuckit because the roll and bounce of the wheel is a little more dramatic than the ball. Chuckit, make a squeaky ring!!, wish I would have researched better i thought it was a bigger flying disk that you could throw out in water. I have big dogs and hard for them to see it, Dont get me wrong, definitely a fun toy! BUT this ring only lasted about 3hrs before it was tore up., My dogs love this thing. It has always been their favorite toy to race after. Tiny learning curve figuring out how to put the ring on the stick without touching it. I have to make sure to put the ring up after we play because my dogs can chew the ring apart in minutes, not so with the ball, that they have trouble destroying., very fun toy for a prey driven dog. takes a few tries to get the motion but once you do its very fun for the dog, This isn’t a bad product but it was tougher to throw and my dog chewed up the ring in 5 minutes. My dog is a tough chewer so I choose the regular rubber tennis balls over this toy in the future. But I will say he LOVED chewing up the ring., This is the best interactive toy ever purchased. The ring goes so far, mimics a squirrel with it’s erratic bouncing. Don’t listen to reviews about it being difficult. Read the instructions and just hold it the right direction. Then it is so easy to throw and goes sooo far. Such a great alternative to tennis balls. And you can rinse it off. If you press on the inner portion of the ring with the launcher it tilts slightly and is easy to pick up hands free. Learn to use it and your pup will be eternally grateful. Even our bull dog gets involved because of her natural prey drive. This really engages all dogs, even lazy and non-retriever breeds. Buy it and you will see it’s the best money spent. , Our 1 year old pup LOVES to chase and play fetch, but nothing seemed to hold her attention for very long. That was until we came across this toy. Holy cow...this girl can run after this ring for HOURS a day, never getting bored. In the few months we've had it, it's helped us with her training and impulse control, and she comes in absolutely EXHAUSTED every time we play (which makes for nice, quiet evenings)! Our pup is a huge chewer but we don't let her chew on this toy, and it's lasted a long time with no damage, just some fading from how often we're out in the sun playing. LOVE IT!, Don't bother! Chuckit! with this Chuckit! toy. too hard to use and doesn't exactly play as well as the ball version. Stick with the ball one.]

title: Chuckit! Max Glow Pro Launcher Dog Toy, 18M
descriptions:
['First thing in the morning or last thing at night – The Chuckit! Max Glow Pro Launcher extends outdoor fetch to any time of day, any season of the year. This durable plastic wand firmly grasps any compatible Chuckit! Ball and then releases it as you swing. This allows for a farther, faster throw and a hands-free, no-slobber pickup once your dog fetches the ball. The high performance ergonomic grip handle is comfortable to hold and the glow technology charges in just 5-10 minutes under any bright light. There’s need for a battery, and once charged, you’ll have up to 30 minutes of glow for a lengthy game of fetch.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', '

                        See all items by Chuckit!
']
key_benefits: ['The entire launcher glows', 'Allows for farther and faster throws', 'Durable plastic wand firmly grasps ball, then releases it as you swing', 'High performance ergonomic grip handle', 'Comes with one Chuckit! ball so you can start the fun right away']
reviews: [Does not seem to go as far as my long one but it makes her happy so that makes me Happy. She will run and run to chase a ball and I have arthritis issues and that is why I have these so I can throw her toys for her. Ms. Zoe is a ball hog, As a petite adult I appreciate the soft rubber grip handle and it's compact frame makes launching the ball easy. There is added fun with it's bright glow in the dark handle., This launcher fits all of my chuck it medium balls and glows really bright in the dark! My dog will love this!, Dog loves chasing after the ball which can be thrown farther with this launcher., Good size and comfy handle. One of the best products I bought for my Aussie. Don’t worry that it’s a bit short. It goes far enough to play fetch with middle sized dogs., Got this for some running options for my doodles. Love it! Great handle. Sturdy and glows BRIGHT., My pup loves playing ball. Chuckit makes my life so much easier as I don’t throw my arm out and can play for a longer period of time with her. Great investment!!, My pup loves playing fetch and this thing SENDS IT!, This by far is the best glowing chuckit !! It glows Super brite and long. It’s fast & east yo charge / make glow and the Handel is super soft & comfortable!! My husband Loves to use it with our little dogs! It makes the coolest whistle sound as it launches in the air & my dogs love it!!! Super fun for the whole family!!, My active golden retriever would fetch balls all day long...this really helps my arm and certainly sends the balls flying. Works well with all our arsenal of tennis balls. Very stury.]

title: PetSafe Automatic Ball Launcher Dog Toy
descriptions:
['The PetSafe Automatic Ball Launcher is an automatic fetching machine that can be used by dog and owner or just the dog. The automatic launcher features make independent play easy and fun, while multiple safety features protect people and pets. The launcher was designed with three motion sensors for optimal safety. A sensor located in the front keeps pets and people safe while walking in front of the launcher, while a sensor in the launch pocket keeps hands and snouts safe. There is an additional sensor to detect when a ball is in the launch pocket to initiate play. Another safety feature allows the dog to play for a full 15 minutes before going into a 15 minute rest mode so the dog does not overwork themselves. There are 6 angle and 9 distance settings to really mix up playtime or to create indoor and outdoor use. Play a short game of indoor fetch at 8 feet or go outside and stretch those legs at 30 feet. Different angles make it extra fun! Plug it in or use 6 D batteries for portable play. The PetSafe Automatic Ball Launcher is safe, fun and totally versatile! Two standard-sized tennis balls, power cord, training instructions and user manual included.', '(2) standard-sized tennis balls, power cord, training instructions and user manual', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', '

                        See all items by PetSafe
']
key_benefits: ['Features make independent play easy and fun, while multiple safety features protect people and pets', 'Designed with three motion sensors for optimal safety: sensor located in the front keeps pets and people safe while walking in front of the launcher, while a sensor in the launch pocket keeps hands and snouts safe and an additional sensor detects when a ball is in the launch pocket to initiate play', 'Safety feature allows the dog to play for a full 15 minutes before going into a 15 minute rest mode so the dog does not overwork themselves', 'Launches between 8-30 feet with 6 angle and 9 distance settings to really mix up playtime or to create indoor and outdoor use', 'Automatic Ball Launcher plays fetch with your dog while interactive features aid in training']
reviews: [I wanted to get one of these for my dogs for a long time. It is cheaply made. Doesn't launch the ball very far at all and after one use it continuously thinks a ball is in there when it isn't and launches nothing but air. If this thing were half the price Id feel more comfortable spending the money but $160+ after taxes? Its laughable. Going to return., It only works sometimes and is super inconsistent. My dog ends up as confused as me wether it will work or not and it never throws the same distance. The distance adjustments don’t even seem to change anything. Waste of money for sure, Right when my dog figured out how to use her ball launcher, it broke. It lasted for 4 days. Not worth the money at all., This is not a big dog device. Very flimsy. Gears/mechanism exposed. Not safe. When ball launches, it causes the other ball to fly out the top. Plastic is thin and brittle., Shoots very far, really strong. The 7ft motion sensor works well. Its worth the money for such a strong stable product. My aussie got the concept right away, my dane on the other hand...still figuring it out., Didn't even get to use this item as it came damaged., I love this auto ball launcher, my puppy does too, great fun for the entire family., This toy is awesome. We have a 7 year old chocolate lab who still has the energy of a puppy. She is obsessed with the ball, so this was a dream com true for her. I was also surprised at how easy it was to train her to put the ball in the toy. It is battery operated and they seem to go quickly, but that’s our only complaint., This toy is awesome! The only bad part is my dog wants to play non stop! But we are having a lot of fun with it., Not sure if it was shipping related or poor product doesn’t work and something is rattling inside]

title: Hyper Pet K9 Kannon Mini K2 Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Take aim and catapult your flinging fun to a whole new level with the Hyper Pet K9 Kannon Mini K2 Dog Toy. This innovative ball launching toy features hands-free ball pick-up, so you don’t have to get your hands slimy before effortlessly hurling the ball 75 feet across the field for hours of fetching fun and great exercise for your petite pooch. It even comes with one of Hyper Pet’s own specially-designed balls that’s been engineered with your little pup’s safety in mind. The ball is made of Grade A rubber so it’s paw-sitively safe on her teeth and doesn’t contain any harmful coatings or gases.', '(1) mini Hyper Pet ball', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', 'Replacement Mini Hyper Pet Balls are available in Green, Orange and Pink.', 'Also available as a regular-size K9 Kannon K2 Toy for medium to large breed dogs.', '

                        See all items by Hyper Pet
']
key_benefits: ['Innovative ball launching toy catapults your fetch game to a whole new level of fun; recommended for use with toy and small breed dogs.', 'Easy-to-use toy effortlessly slings balls up to 75 feet for hours of fetching fun and great exercise for your petite pooch.', 'Hands-free operation lets you pick up retrieved balls without getting your hands slimy by simply pressing them into the barrel of the launcher.', 'Comes with one mini Hyper Pet ball made of Grade A rubber and containing no coatings or gases so it’s safe for your little dog.', 'Uses specially-designed 1.88-inch mini tennis balls; convenient two-ball storage located under barrel.']
reviews: [I used to really enjoy this companies products. I purchased a mini ball launcher similar to this one and it lasted almost two years! Then once the rubber band finally broke, I bought a new full sized canon. We were excited to play with the new toy, but after not even a few hours, the trigger snapped and the fun was over. I just purchased two new mini launcher believing the the full sized canon was too strong for its own good, but yet again, after only a few hours of play the mini canon broke. Seems that these toys must now be poorly made and no longer worth purchasing., The first day my little shih tzu was scared of this because it makes quite a noise when pulling back the plunger to load the ball and a loud click when the trigger is pulled. She would run after the ball after I faked a throw but was afraid to bring it back. I was disappointed but didn't give up as this thing is an arm saver and fun to shoot. By day 2 she had grasped the concept and accepted the noise as friendly and we now enjoy a fun play day. It will shoot smaller balls also but you have to hold the end up so the ball doesn't roll out. Also the newer the ball the further it will shoot. Its like playing tennis, older balls are less bouncy. I highly recommend this toy., I go crazy when my mom gets out the bag with the gun in it. I love to dig in the snow to find the ball. In fact I sometimes bury it again. I look beautiful with tiny snowball on my face., Our Lola Mae absolutely loves this! We have to limit her to 15 minutes each time we play or she wears herself out. She knows where we keep it, when we go by the door she goes buzerk she wants to play so bad! She loves to play ball anyway so this gives us human’s a rest on our arm from throwing the ball!, My 6mth old puppy loves this toy. She hears the clicks and knows the ball is about to come out. It doesn't matter that the ball doesn't go all that far because she is a 20lb pup. Also, the mini balls fit in her mouth and are easy for her to carry. It has been a great way to help her burn off energy and the excitement is contagious (I love to take her out and "shoot the balls"). (Her brother is 80lbs and has the larger gun with larger balls and she doesn't like the large balls - oh,and we're not quite as please with the larger gun which doesn't shoot the balls very far at all). I recommend this gun highly. Don't leave it outside (in the cold) cocked,though, because the rubber band gets loose, disappointed. I have a big dog so the balls are too small for him.., I got this for my nieces daughters dog, Susie, who loves to fetch. She loves it!, Our Pug LOVES this toy! He can play fetch until he drops! Great purchase. Well made product. I wish I could add video, of him playing fetch with it. It is fun!, My dog loves this toy, and so do I! He loves to play catch and throwing the ball all the time makes the arm tired. And the ball ends up getting slimy too. This toy takes care of both of the problems at once. And it is worth the price., Love this thing and so do my dogs. Hours of fun with it! Wears my dogs right out! And they are always wagging those tails when I get it out]

title: iFetch Too Automatic Ball Launcher Dog Toy
descriptions:

It’s perfect for when you’re away or busy doing other things—like getting his dinner ready—while ensuring he gets all the mental and physical exercise that he needs. All you have to do is plug it in, choose your launching distance and then drop in a tennis ball. Soon your dog will learn how to drop it himself, which stimulates his mind and allows for totally independent play.', '(3) Pack of iFetch Standard Tennis Balls, AC Charger for the Internal Rechargeable Battery.', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. reviews: [I bought this Dec 30 , 2018 . Today I’d Oct. 1 2020. It was the center of my dogs world ! He wore it out today , it tosses the ball about 6” on the highest setting . Is it worth $100.00 a year ? Raz would bark yes... me..... I just wish it lasted longer. He’s worth buying another one for ., Didn't launch nearly as far as advertised, and the balls got stuck after two or three throws, every time. Complete waste of money, We bought racquetballs to replace the tennis balls, after reading reviews & knowing how our dog likes to destroy fuzzy tennis balls. Still working on him dropping the ball into the launcher on his own, but we are training in increments: bring the ball to the launcher, nudge the ball out of my hand into the launcher, and [hopefully soon] dropping it in himself. He understands that this device will throw the balls for him, and he keeps trying to bark at it or stick his nose in the holes. It stays powered on if plugged in, but seems to go to sleep to save energy. Wakes up if a ball is dropped in. The lowest setting works well in our apartment, but we need to make sure it isn't aimed towards, My dog is enjoying the toy. It's a great idea, but my biggest problem is just the quality of the device and the balls. The first time we were using it on the 10, the ball would get stuck inside. I bumped it up to the next level and that seemed to help, but my dog already destroyed 2 of the 3 balls. Lucky I ordered a second set (which still hasn't arrived even though I ordered it a week ago....) But I will not buy any more ifetch balls., I about love chewy. They are fast and their products are great. I do have a issue with the product that I recently purchased. This is a manufacturer’s issue not chewy. I brought a ball launcher for my dog and some pieces fall off. This happens when my dog pushes it . Top ring and ring where ball shoots out falls off a lot. Other than that it’s good., Bought this product and it only worked one time. I have a very disappointed Boston Terrier. Had to return the item. They promised me another one and then told me it was not in stock anymore. Very disappointed, Did not work last year for a Christmas present so I returned it. Bought it again this year, didn't work this year either, This is a great product but it just doesn't shoot far enough for my Border Collie. She will drop the balls in and watch it shoot but it doesn't launch high enough to catch. She prefers the Nerf gun., I’m very disappointed in this product. It barely tosses the ball no matter which setting, Border Collie Playtime, He loves it. I bought this for my boy three years ago, he will be four in October. Took him about 30 day to learn how to use it. We have it set up in the house in the winter so he can get exercise without getting wet and muddy. In the summer we move it outside under the overhang of the house so it doesn't get wet if it rains. This machine is pure heaven and no more throwing a nasty dirty ball. I used the blue tennis balls that came with the machine, they are garbage. They are hard and they shattered after about 10 mins of play. Pretty crappy that you blow through 3 brand new balls that come with your machine in less then 45 mins. Well I got over that fact fast, because]

title: Spunky Pup Squeak & Throw Ball Launcher Dog Toy
descriptions:
['Give your dog an exercise woof-out with the Spunky Pup Squeak & Throw Ball Launcher Dog Toy. He’ll love chasing tennis balls up to 100 feet and you’ll love having a launcher to help you make the throw. It features a convenient design that allows you to pick up a tennis ball hands-free so you don’t have to worry about dirt or drool. Along the top of the launcher is a back scratcher for rewarding your doggo for a fetch well-done. If he starts to get distracted, simply push the squeaker on the handle to get his attention back before making another paw-some toss.', '
                No toy is indestructible. Supervise your pet when using since small parts can present a choking hazard or internal blockage. Discontinue use if the toy is damaged. Keep out of reach of children.
', '

']

title: Nerf Dog Air Strike Launcher Dog Toy, 25-in
descriptions:
['If you’re tired of picking up your dog’s tennis ball with your bare hands, then Nerf Dog’s Air Strike Launcher is the perfect solution! This easy-to-use dog toy allows you to easily cup and throw your pup’s tennis ball without getting all his slobber on you. Its lightweight and flexible design make it easy and comfortable for pet parents to use and it’s especially great for those who suffer from shoulder, back or knee issues. Every Air Strike Launcher comes with a squeaky Nerf Dog tennis ball, so you and your best bud can get to playing right away!', '

                        See all items by Nerf Dog
']
key_benefits: ['Helps keep your hands clean during a game of fetch with your sidekick.', 'Designed to allow pet parents to easily cup and throw the ball without bending down.', 'The lightweight, flexible and curved design is easy to use and comfortable for most pet parents.', 'A great option for pet parents with shoulder, back and knee injuries.', 'Every purchase comes with a squeaky tennis ball, so can use your Air Strike Launcher right away!']
reviews: [Fits all tennis balls, the ball that comes with the launcher lasted 2 throws. Best bet would be buy other balls. Launcher works great throws ball far and provides lots of exercise, My dog received this as a Christmas present. I love the product. Only negative I found so far is the ball was a dud. Didn't bounce at all. I use a regular tennis ball with it., While it lasted. We did one round of fetch. I left it In the back yard and 1 of three pups must have been too rough with it and broke the cup the ball fits in. I’ll definitely be ordering a new one when I can., I am giving this item a 5-star review because I bought this item for the thrower itself and not the ball. The thrower is awesome and being able to hold an extra ball is a huge bonus because sometimes we lose one and then all the fun is over! I do agree with all of the other comments that the ball is not the best. Our lasted maybe 6 trips to the park before it got a hole and didn't throw right so we have since tossed it. Thankfully we have tons of tennis balls to replace it with!, The Air Strike Launcher Dog really doesn't bring much to the table over your normal throwing arm. Take the money you'd spend on this toy and buy a couple more tennis balls or something unique like the Hartz Dura Play balls instead. They're super tough and (according to the package) taste like bacon. Our dog loves his. This toy has been relegated to gathering dust in our pantry., Works great for keeping up with our puppy lab who wants to fetch balls all day long., I bought this for two reasons. One, I watch dogs often and some are more energetic than others and my arm will get tired way before they do. And two, I like to play with my neighbor’s dog that loves balls. But he will drop his ball right at the base of our chain link fence on his side, and I can’t reach it to pick it back up. This works perfectly to reach over and scoop the ball up to throw it again!!, Great if you buy different tennis balls for it. The nerf one broke in literally one retrieve. My BC bit it right in half. Guess I'll order some chuckit balls instead for it! If it hadn't been on sale for so cheap, i would've just bought another chuckit launcher. Works the same and the tennis balls actually are useful, This is great for helping pick balls up off of the ground so you don't have to keep bending over. Not long enough to prevent you from having to bend at all, but it really helps! The ball that came with it is just okay, nothing special., My dad’s dog absolutely loves this!!! She loves fetch and will bring me this to play with her!! It’s also great because it’s hard to get the ball from her sometimes and this makes it easy!!]

reviews: [Our pup loves to play ball and our chuck it thrower worked wonderfully until our shoulders screamed in pain. We ordered the HyperPet launcher and using by hand it does not go any farther than a hand throw and it is difficult to pull back. I mounted it on a post and it worked wonderfully for two days and one band broke. I shortened the opposite band and got two more days and it broke. We have ordered three more bands but cannot afford to do this once a week! I do not recommend this product. Total waste of money!, This tennis ball slingshot is a pain to pull back. If they had manufactured it the way most slingshots are (with a counter brace over the top of the wrist to add stability while drawing the sling) they would have made a better product., Throw it by hand much farther. Get a chuck it hand thrower., Great concept and I was excited to try it out. It takes a lot of "pull" to get the ball to go anywhere worthwhile. Furthest I got it to go was about 50ft. Went back to my ChuckIt and its 100 - 150ft throws. Our dog is much happier again., Great launcher the dog really enjoys it,I would recommend these products to anyone having a dog., Great length it goes. Not 1 hand user friendly but great if you need to launch a good length away to make fetch simple and quick. Would be better if there was a finger tab to pull back and release, This is a well made product, yes. But....unless you are John Cena or a professional bow and arrow shooter, hang it up. You have to have wrists of steel to use this. Buy the sling shot that has the forearm support. My 27 year old son who works out had a hard time using this. Chewy had me donate it, which I gladly did., For a man, this would be a GREAT thing to use in playing with your dog. For a 59 year old woman, not so much. Not the products fault, I should have thought about it before ordering for myself to play with my dogs in the backyard., Its too stiff and hard to pull. My husband tried it and it doesn't work right, We bought once of these when they were commonly found in stores when our ShepX was a puppy. he LOVED this thing. Just seeing it, he would get very excited. We did have to buy a number of replacement bands. More so once storing it in a plastic cabinet on our covered porch, in the hot and cold more than when it was inside. We had bought replacement bands over Ebay, as at the time it was the only place to find them. The generic are cheaper, though that 2 pack lasted as long as one of the actual replacements made by hyperpet. It has a few rusty spots now due to being stored with damp balls on it. Buddy Boy crossed the bridge last summer, but we kept this as we figured he would want us to make some]

title: iDogmate Smart Automatic Dog Ball Launcher Toy, Medium & Large Dogs
descriptions:
['Keep your pup entertained and on his toes with iDogmate’s Smart Automatic Pet Launcher Dog Toy! Available in a size small and a size medium/large, this intriguing toy is designed to launch balls 10, 20, 30 and 35 feet in the air. Choose between the 4 distances or choose the variable setting and watch your furry friend try to guess how far the next ball will go! Plus, the balls are felted, so they are gentle on teeth and gums. This launcher runs on an AC adapter (included) or a rechargeable li-ion battery (included), which can last for up to 250 launches when fully charged! Paw-fect for indoor or outdoor play, this toy is sure to keep your BFF busy and entertained.', 'Launcher, Adapter, (3) Balls, Remote, Manual', '
                No toy is indestructible. Supervise your pet when using since small parts can present a choking hazard or internal blockage. Discontinue use if the toy is damaged. Keep out of reach of children.
', '

                        See all items by iDogmate
']
key_benefits: ['Comes with a rechargeable li-ion battery that can deliver enough power for up to 250 launches.', 'Choose between 4 distances or a variable setting using the remote control.', 'Sends balls 10, 20, 30 or 35 feet in the air.', 'Doesn’t create a lot of noise and features an anti-stuck motor to accommodate slobbery toys.', 'Designed with internal storage for the balls and has two handles for easy portability.']
reviews: [I ordered the small launcher and my Corgi loves this. It took me less than 24 hours to train my dog. At first she was cautious of the sound, Now it’s her cue to get ready to fetch. My two complaints are that the balls are poorly made, coming apart rather quickly… We went through three balls in less than 10 days. I reordered 2.5” balls and realized that this machine does not take that size...it requires much smaller balls. the small launcher does not use the 2.5 inch ball as stated in the description/Q&A. The smaller balls are still $13- $15 for three balls that I know will be destroyed in less than 10 days and that is disheartening. Perhaps the price of the balls should be reduced if the balls, The balls that came with it didn't last long but it does work with 2.5 diameter balls. It just seems a little flimsy for the price but my Shepherd enjoys it., This ball launcher is the best; however, the balls are very poor quality, they easily break.]

reviews: [We've had Hyper Pet Slingshot for about 10 years. Our dogs have loved chasing and catching the balls. Hours of fun entertainment! Chewy had the best price for the replacements and was so fast to get them to us! title: Outward Hound Zip Stick Launcher Dog Toy, Green, Large
descriptions:
['Get ready for a zippin’ good time with Outward Hound’s Zip Stick Launcher Dog Toy! This play-session essential can launch Outward Hound’s Woofie Ballz (included as well as sold separately) up to 100 feet in the air! It also features plastic ridges along the toy that create an enticing “zip” sound when the Woofie Ballz are released. The long, lightweight, curved launcher also makes it easy for you to pick the balls up without using your hands—that means no more slobbery fingers! Welcome to the future of fetch!', '

                        See all items by Outward Hound
']
key_benefits: ['Can send Outward Hound’s Woofie Ballz (included as well as sold separately) soaring up to 100 feet in the air!', 'Features plastic ridges that create a fun “zip” sound when the Woofie Ballz are released.', 'Can launch up to 3 Woofie Ballz at the same time, making it paw-fect for multi-dog households.', 'Allows for hands-free pick-up—gone are the days of slobbery fingers!', 'Lightweight and easy to hold for comfortable play sessions.']
reviews: [This toy is great. We have 2 Golden Retrievers and one of them has a strong drive for retrieving and the other one not so much. With this toy they can play together and both have fun at the same time. The zip sound seems to add motivation to play time. The balls are very durable. The price was great too, I have had so much fun using this with my 5 month old golden retriever puppy! He is, of course, a ball of energy. He has a hard time fetching larger, heavier balls just yet, and will often lose interest after a few throws because of that. These balls are the perfect solution since they're much lighter weight and have the openings to help him carry them back! Also love that the balls aren't fabric like tennis balls so they're easy to rinse off if they get muddy. The "zip" sound really keeps him excited and engaged, too. One of the best toys I've ever bought!, It doesn’t go as far as the chuck it we love, but the fun zip sound it makes is cool! Its actually perfect for my backyard since I tend to throw the chuck it too far and it goes over the fence sometimes. One reason I’m not giving it five stars is we have only been using it a few days and the ball is starting to wear. For the price, though, cant be beat!, My dog loves this toy. She loves the zip sound and she loves to chase the balls. It’s even better since multiple balls can be thrown each time. She enjoys the tennis ball launcher on occasion, but she is engaged with this toy almost every time I take it out. The balls are lightweight and easy for her to hold in her mouth and squish a bit, which she seems to enjoy. They have stood up to a Labrador Retriever’s chewing for a few weeks so far!, My pups don't always like the same toys, but they both love this one! My oldest is especially hard to please and this is now one of his favorites!, Ok, we currently have another launcher and must say for the price this is a great toy! Balls are hollow, the handle is light, easy to pick up and you can fling the balls super far., Although it doesn't launch as far, my dog is obsessed w this toy. These are the only types of balls that he fetches. The balls are light and open compared to other balls., My ball fetching grandpuppy could not be happier and neither could I. No more picking up and throwing slobbery balls. And this sucker flings these special balls pretty far which helps wear his puppy energy out. Love it!!, My 2 american pitbulls love this new fetch toy I got for them., Lame! Cost too much, there is no launching really. You just toss it off the stick]

title: Hyper Pet Ultimate Fetch Dog Toy Pack, 3-pack
descriptions:
["No matter where you and your pup play, play hard with the Ultimate Fetch dog toy pack from Hyper Pet. This dynamite variety pack comes with several toys designed for those long afternoons of tossing, fetching and catching! With the Hyper Fling launcher, you can throw further than ever—this handy launcher does the hard work for you and effortlessly flings the included tennis ball up to 100 feet away. And the ball? It's a multi-textured sphere made of grade-a rubber, so it's built fly, bounce, and endure buckets of slobber. If your fun takes you to the water, remember to bring the foam ball that's gentle enough for your hardwood floors and buoyant enough for water play. Your pup will love getting her paws wet to fetch, and you'll love bonding with your furry friend. And, if that's not enough, toss The Fun Square—soft on the inside, but built with a tough, nylon shell on the outside. You'll have everything you need to have a ball with your dog.", '(1) Hyper Fling Launcher, (2) Hyper Fling Pro Tennis Ball, (1) Hyper Fling Pro Chewz Ball, & (1) Hyper Fling Pro Fun Square', '

']
key_benefits: ['This ultimate fetch collection includes everything you need to "go long!" with your best bud, whether in your own backyard or your favorite dog park.', 'The Hyper Fling launcher will send the included tennis ball soaring up to 100 feet away, for extreme games of fetch with your extreme pup.', "Squares aren't uncool anymore—an easy-to-throw square toy made with a nylon outer shell and a squishy foam interior is safe to toss indoors and out.", 'Multi-textured tennis ball is great for tossing, flinging and fetching because of its durable, grade-A rubber construction and irregular, hard-to-catch bounce.', 'Lightweight foam ball is safe to toss against your hardwood floors and floats in water, too—ideal for nights in, days by the pool, or weekends at the lake.']
reviews: [Thanks to Chewy for refunding this item. The design of this thrower is unusual, it's probably some engineering marvel, but darned if I can say it's any better than a regular cheap plastic thrower. Be aware that HyperPet is designed with a hole in each device. Put the ball over the post, throw. Sometimes it comes off, sometimes it doesn't. I can throw with my old-lady arm better than use this device. You'll not be able to use old tennis balls, etc. with this device. My dog chewed the square within a day. I accidentally hit him couple times with the metal (?) Hyper Pet thrower. Save your money. Go back to the regular throwers. I'm not a fan of this engineering., Great for not wanting to get your hands dirty! My Dads shepard loves the foam like ball thingy! Big fan., This comes with a tennis type ball and a hard ball. I prefer the tennis ball.]

reviews: [This toy wasn’t even out of the wrapper 10 minutes and the stitching came out in 2 places. Don’t get me wrong, great concept and fun toy just cheap material. Our dog loved it but we couldn’t risk her ingesting the stuffing. If the product is ever made with more durable material, we would try it again., I opened the package, pulled back the launcher, and it snapped on first launch attempt. Never got to play with the toy. Will try other launch products. Dog loves fetch!!!, Unfortunately, froggy only lasted 3 days after delivery. Sampson is a 10 month old Old English Bulldog and took Froggy's head off.. so Froggy does not fly anymore..., This toy is fun for both you and your pet but if you have a chewer, I do not recommend. It took one day for him to rip the thumb slot off, shred along the lining and tear out the stuffing., I thought it was well made I just have a super chewer that tears everything up we called it Rocket Man. I'd pull head up 2x yell Rocket man & throw it. She torn head off 1st!, Cheap product! I shot it about 5 feet twice and on the third try the head came off, Our 4 month old puppy destroyed this toy in 15 mins. I wouldn’t recommend.]

The Slinger's long neck and easy-grip handle make games of fetch more comfortable than ever while allowing you to launch that ball further than ever. title: Spunky Pup Ball Blaster Ball Launcher Dog Toy
descriptions:

key_benefits: ['This lightweight launcher can send balls soaring up to 60 feet in the air!', 'Allows for convenient hands-free pickup so you don’t have to bend down and pick up your dog’s slobbery toy.', '100% powered by air—that means no hazardous springs or elastic bands.', 'The more air you pump into the toy, the further the ball will go!', 'Comes with one tennis ball, so you can get the fun started right away!']
reviews: [Shoots the ball about 3 feet, if that... I do not recommend, This thing doesn't even launch the ball 10 feet. Idk how in the world they got it to do that in the video. I got mad after shooting it twice and never picked it back up.. get a better brand don't waste your money!, Just received ours and must agree. Don't bother. Wish we'd seen jagfangrandma's review before we ordered it. She's right on. First time we fired it went about 3 feet - straight into the dog's mouth. Second try took nearly 30 pumps (first 5-10 don't even take)and the ball went all of 15 feet. Whoo. Going back to our trusty K-9 Kannon, This thing didn't throw the ball 10 feet and even that was an effort to get it to throw that far. Don't waste your money. 10 feet is nothing for our golden retriever he's at the ball site before the ball even gets there.]

title: Ruff Dawg Cat-A-Pult Launching Dog Toy, Color Varies
descriptions:
['Ruff Dawg Cat-A-Pult Launching Dog Toy is a vanilla-scented toy made of 100% superior grade rubber that is tear and puncture resistant. You’ll never have to worry about sharp edges, breaking or splinters. The catapult is designed to be stretched and launched through the air for hours and hours of fetching fun. And it floats in water, so you both can enjoy some fetching fun in the pool, lake or ocean too.', 'Ships in a variety of random and fun colors!', 'Every dog plays differently and, since not all toys are created equal, it’s always best to keep a close watch on your pup in case things get ruff. Supervised play will help toys last longer and most importantly keep your pal safe. No dog toy is truly indestructible, so always remove the toy from playtime if pieces begin to break off.', '

']
key_benefits: ['A vanilla-scented toy made of 100% superior grade rubber that is tear and puncture resistant', 'Designed to be stretched and launched through the air for hours and hours of fetching fun', 'It floats in water, so you both can enjoy some fetching fun in the pool, lake or ocean too', 'Fill the Cat-a-Pult with treats and launch this safe toy for training and exercising your four-legged friends', 'Gentle on teeth and gums, perfect for puppies and older dogs!']
reviews: [My dog LOVES this toy but I really have to keep an eye on him with it because it's incredibly thin material. If he were left to his own devices with this toy, it wouldnt have lasted 5 minutes out of the box. Overall, it's fun but I wouldnt purchase again because he is a chewer and it's just not strong enough for that., The item I received was covered in dirt when it arrived which actually discolored the item permanently. Seems like maybe it was a return that someone tossed out in the yard and decided they didn’t like. I haven’t actually tried it yet because it’s not something I could just give to my pup to play with. She would destroy it in minutes. I shoulda returned it but had already ripped off the packaging before I realized it was discolored., I have one puppy; she is a chewer for sure. That's why I was excited when this said it was tear and puncture resistant. NOT! My puppy broke it into pieces within 8 minutes. Had to basically throw it all out so she wouldn't eat the plastic pieces. Extremely disappointed. It's so hard to find durable toys for her but at least don't claim to be if you aren't!, My 75lb lab likes this toy for fetch. We took it to the beach for her to retrieve and she brought it back but did not seem enthused.....it has a hole in the top of and back of head and I am fairly certain she took in a mouthful of salt water while retrieving it. So this is a no for the beach but would be great for a pool or lake!, Can't chew it up, can't break it. It tugs (if it is allowed in your house); you can shake it, throw it, toss it. But best of all when the dog tosses it into your TV screen, it softly bounces off with no damage done. I love this toy, have bought many of them so there is always one nearby.]
